Concerts.name: EDM Nite
Concerts.description: EDM Night is one of the most electric nights of Mood Indigo with crowd coming from all over the country to enjoy concerts featuring top DJs from around the world. Since its inception in 2013, eminent DJs including Bassjackers, Vinai, Sander van Doorn, Borgeous, Nucleya have graced the coveted Gymkhana stage at Mood Indigo.

events.name: Ummet Ozcan
events.description:
In an age where very few artists break the mold and truly shine through as unique and innovative, Dutch star Ummet Ozcan is one of the exceptions to the rule. Not only because of his advanced studio knowledge and the impressive string of dance floor hits this resulted in, it’s also thanks to his enduring presence at worldwide mainstages these last years. A success story that’s about to enter new grounds.
 
Growing up in the known epicentre of dance music, The Netherlands, it isn’t difficult for Ozcan to plunge into dance music at an early age. “The EDM scene has been very big here since I was a teenager. We’ve had dance music playing on radio stations for over 20 years now”, he explains. So, as soon as he’s good and ready, music starts to come out of Ozcan’s studio.
It won’t take long before he gets the attention he deserves. Since achieving his first major success in 2011 with ‘Reboot’, which spends seven weeks at #1 on Beatport, the veteran DJ’s major hits have been sampled in his peers’ radio podcasts and played at festival mainstages all over the world.
 
Catch him playing live on 27th December at Gymkhana grounds, IIT Bombay

events.name: Progressive Brothers
events.description: The Progressive Brothers is an Electronic/Dance Duo act consisting of Sunny Sharma and Karan Bhalla. Talk about the Pioneers of Electronic Music scene in India,and it’s nearly impossible that your ears haven’t caught up with name of this EDM-Pop Duo ‘The Progressive Brothers’. They have given world-class performances in almost every corner of the country and specialise in making sure you get off your seat and hit the stage to break a leg !The Progressive Brothers have shared stage with artists like DJ Snake, Dimitri Vegas Like Mike, David Guetta, Tiesto, Martin Garrix, Kygo, Afrojack, KSHMR, Clean Bandit, Steve Aoki and many more.

Concerts.name: Livewire Nite
Concerts.description: Livewire Night, of Mood Indigo, has been one of the grandest platforms for top international rock and metal bands to perform at in India. This night has pulled some of the top bands in the world  like Simple Plan, Porcupine Tree, Epica, Haken, Karnivool and many more! With state of the art production, and some of the best bands from all over the globe, this night has been the highlight of the festival for many metalheads up and down the country.

events.name: Leprous
events.description:
Leprous is a progressive metal band from Notodden, Norway, formed in 2001. Leprous' style is typically classified as progressive metal or progressive rock and it singled out for its progressive elements, peculiar harmonies, singing style, and blending of different genres. Their sound has also been categorized as experimental rock, avant-garde metal, and pop. However, the band's members do not affiliate themselves with a specific genre.

Einar Solberg, one of the band’s founding members, claims inspiration from Radiohead, Massive Attack, Arvo Pärt, Susanne Sundfør, Behemoth, and The Prodigy in addition to more analogous progressive bands such as Porcupine Tree and The Dillinger Escape Plan.

In a time where progressive music is emerging and there are so many options available to new listeners, it takes serious guts and personality to turn heads anymore. Norway’s Leprous has done just that in recent years, and it has been such a joy to watch them emerge into the limelight of awareness within the progressive community. It is no wonder, however, as Leprous continues to mature and to cling ever closer to their hearts when crafting new music.

Leprous is a visionary band that defies genre labelling, not just in the style, but also in their attitude. Leprous, however, is not a band that takes success resting on their hind quarters, as they believe in pushing boundaries, learning from their mistakes, and following their instincts. This was proved when they released their new album “Malina” this summer, and offered a left hook to the progressive world.

events.name: aswekeepsearching
events.description:
Aswekeepsearching has been turning heads and perking up ears over the world for a while now, spreading a message of positivity and good times in a way only they can, while keeping their feet planted firmly on the ground. 
Their music is an aural painting, cathartic and unbiased, vividly colourful and infinitely kind. From the first bar of the music till the curtain drops, it is apparent that the four members, fuelled by idealism and the drive to build something beautiful, are set out to move mountains. The albums also see the use of instruments like the Violin, Viola, Cello, Sitar and the Tabla, having collaborated with like-minded artists on some songs, who've added their own unique colour to the bands soundscape.

Concerts.name: Fusion Nite
Concerts.description: We at Mood Indigo, have something for everyone. Fusion Night adds the Indian essence that has been missing from your concerts. Be there to revel in the glory of semi-classical and indie music. With performances by Anand Bhaskar Collective and Clinton Cerejo Collective, this Night has given Mood Indigo some of the most enchanting sets in it’s long 47 year history.

events.name: Papon
events.description:
Angaraag Mahanta, popularly known as Papon, is a singer, multi-instrumentalist, composer and record producer. Blessed with a voice that’s smooth and soulful at the same time, his innovative experiments are rich with ambient electronica, acoustic folk, electro ghazals to classical sounds. Papon can sing effortlessly in Hindi, Punjabi, Marathi, Tamil, Bengali, and Gujarati language.

In Bollywood, Papon’s rise to fame was with the songs like ‘Moh Moh Ke Dhage’ from Dum Laga Ke Haisha, ‘Kyon’ from Barfi ,‘Jiyein Kyun’ from the movie Dum Maro Dum, ‘Labon Ka Karobar’ for the movie Befikre etc. In 2018, Papon has lent his voice to songs in movie Sanju, Raid, Karwaan, Sui Dhaaga. Papon has been a pioneer of Indian independent music & has co-composed songs like ‘Har Ek Baat’ and ‘Naina Laagey’ with pioneering producers Midival Punditz. He has also collaborated with renowned composer-multi instrumentalist Karsh Kale on the track ‘Absence’ for Karsh Kale’s fifth studio album.

He was awarded as the Best Male Playback Singer 2016 at Star Screen Awards, Mirchi Music
Awards, TOIFA, GIMA, IIFA-Madrid. Papon was also nominated for Best Male Playback Singer at the FILMFARE Awards and Zee Cine Awards in 2016. His concert on 29th December will be surely something to look forward for all the Indian music lovers!

Proshows.name: International Music Festival
Proshows.description: One good thing about music - when it hits you, you feel no pain. International Music Festival presents a synergic blend of world-class performers showcasing diverse cultures and stimulating our senses with their exquisite musical performances. Groove to the amazing music from artists across the world, belonging to different cultures across the world. This unique medley of genres will surely provide a well needed break from the monotonous life and let you delve into the intoxicating sea of festive music

events.name: Aditi Ramesh
events.description: Aditi Ramesh is a jazz/blues/Carnatic vocalist, songwriter and producer based out of Mumbai. She is known for her strong hold on tonal modulations and her ability to mix classical carnatic music with jazz. Formerly a corporate lawyer since quitting in the end of 2016, her musicality has experienced  exponential growth in her soundscape, with her performance incorporating keys, drums and bass as well as the use of her eloquent voice as an instrument, used to create symphonic harmonies and intricate melodies.

events.name: The Yellow Diary
events.description: A 5 member Music Collective hail from varied backgrounds, but have one thing in common -- their passion for music. With a blend of electronic music and rock, they are touted to be a composition powerhouse. They have released two EP’s this year titled ‘Marz’ & ‘Izafa’ consisting three songs each . The soundscape, of these songs have a large-room, anthemic and has a sing-along quality that will have you crooning to the lyrics as soon you hear them.

events.name: Between the Jars
events.description: Between The Jars… that is where this young and promising band from The Netherlands compose its music. This band, established in 2015, create an unique mixture of genres, best to be defined as psychedelic 70s rock. With their groovy feeling, they bring the crowd in ecstatic vibes. Their performance at Mood Indigo will be their first show outside Europe and also the first of their India tour, which consists of gigs in Bhayandar, Pune and another one in Mumbai. Their music is influenced by famous bands like Deep Purple, Led Zeppelin, The Doors and many more.

events.name: Keegan Oxland
events.description: Hailing from South Africa, Oxland has found a way to produce and play live sampled electronic drum rhythms. Incorporating big trap drops to hip hop while juggling his sticks making it a performance not to be missed! Find the hype on his social media

events.name: Anthracite
events.description: Anthracite, a six-member Rap-Rock band hails from Mumbai. Since their origin in 2012, they’ve been in the local gig circuit of India. In 2016, they went on to become India’s first Linkin Park tribute act, with a setlist of over 40 songs. After three India tours and countless shows across the country, they were officially called to play a launch party gig for Linkin Park's latest album One More Light, at a special preview show in Mumbai which was recognized by Sony Music and Linkin Park.

events.name: Jim Porto
events.description:
Brazilian singer, songwriter and pianist Jim Porto had his first contact with music at a tender age of six - fascinated by the nimble hands of a friend running up and down the keyboard. He studied piano in his hometown, Rio Grande (RS), mixing classical music with popular styles, such as Samba and Bossa Nova. 
He is accompanied by the Indian musicians - Avishek Dey on the Bass, Andrew Kanga on the drums and Ryan Sadri on the Saxophone

events.name: Indian Air
events.description:
Since his first awareness of Indian music and the sitar more than 20 years ago, the Austrian musician Klaus Falschlunger has become a master of the instrument and an active representative of the Indian-Music scene in Europe.
The whole emotional spectrum of the musician´s inner world comes alive in "INDIAN AIR".
He is accompanied by Clemens Rofner on double bass, and by the percussionist Tobias Steinberger on framedrums/kanjira.
Growing up with jazz and rock music, he discovered in his extensive travels to Asia, the Middle East and Europe, more and more the diversity of music.His creativity and versatility brought him together with many musicians and artists from India, Korea, USA and Europe.

events.name: Tarq Bowen
events.description:
Tarq's unique blend of Blues, Soul and hard-hitting slide guitar interfaced with powerful yet gentle dynamic ability shows an understanding and skill far beyond his years. This has attracted the attention of Nick Mason (Pink Floyd) who recorded Tarq's debut single, remaining a big avid supporter of his music.
Last year Tarq had the rare opportunity to be personally invited by Tony Visconti, to play alongside Nitin Sawhney and Stewart Copeland of The Police, in a 6 piece documentary which led to Tarq flying to L.A. to work with veteran producer Larry Klein.

Whilst Tarq draws inspiration from the likes of Debussy, Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan and Chet Baker, his sound has been compared more accurately to artists such as Jeff Buckley and Howlin Wolf. 
Playing with his live band Tarq's sound invites the audience on a magnetic journey infused with energy and soul, leaving a unique memory that will evolve every time you see him.

Tarq will feature his international Trio at the Mood Indigo festival, Tarq Bowen (UK) on Vocals & Guitars, Phil Wildenhues (NL) on Drums and Marc-Inti (BOL) on E-Bass. As a special guest Amit Mishra (IND) will join them on Tabla.

Proshows.name: Theatrefest
Proshows.description: All the world's a stage. TheatreFest brings people from all aspects of Theatre under one roof and celebrates the sheer brilliance of theatrical performances. It offers an enthusiastic environment for interaction between the performers and the masses. Experience some of the most intelligent and emotionally stimulating acts you are ever likely to see. Collective sighs, pin-drop silences and everything in between will be your constant companions. Experience the plays and theatrical performances which will stir up your soul and leave you mesmerized with a smile on your face or a tear upon your cheek.

events.name: Dekh Behen
events.description: After 42 shows across four cities in just nine months, “Dekh Behen” comes to TheatreFest at Mood Indigo, IIT Bombay. Dekh Behen is a play written and directed by women with an all-female cast and crew. Set in the backdrop of an elaborate Punjabi wedding, this hilarious play is about women, by women, for anyone who wants to understand what it’s like to be a woman. This is a bittersweet comedy about sisters, wives, girlfriends, daughters, mothers, and above all – women. The play has left the audience laughing breathlessly with the hilarious exchanges between the characters. Plot Summary - A big fat Delhi wedding is underway. Merely hours before they need to put up their rehearsed item number, five bridesmaids catch up, gossip and bitch about their identical outfits. But that's not the only thing they have in common. They all dislike the bride. Akvarious Productions presents a bittersweet comedy about daughters, girlfriends, mothers and getting through one dramatic Indian wedding.

events.name: Stand Up
events.description: Akvarious Productions presents 'Stand Up - a serious play about comedy', starring BhaDiPa stars Nipun Dharmadhikari and Sarang Sathaye, with Abir Abrar (from Karwaan), Adhaar Khurana (from Boygiri), Kashin Shetty (winner of META Best Supporting Actor for The Interview), Omkar Kulkarni (from Aladdin), famous rapper SlowCheeta, and Zayn Khan (from Dekh Behen). Hold your seats for the uncontrollable laughter as this play unfolds into real-life yet crazy situations.

events.name: Anji
events.description: Dinesh Thakur’s Ank presents Vijay Tendulkar’s  Matchless Satirical  Comedy, ANJI. Undaunted by the fact that she is getting on in years but is yet to find the right match,  Anjali  Sharma (Anji) sets out to search for her dream man herself. The story of  Anji who holds forth her positive attitude inspite of trying situations and a life going nowhere, but is yet stumped in the face of a pitiless society. An  explosive climax persuades us to re-examine our value system, especially concerning women.

events.name: Blueticks
events.description:
It is simply about teenage love story these days, The internet has simplified 'finding love' but complicated 'staying in it' Relationships have transformed from cozy couples to curious love triangles, boy, girl and the notorious smartphone.
Blue Ticks explores this bizarre chemistry between friendship and technology and takes you back to the good old days where communications were intimate and real.
Considered one of the most popular plays among youngsters, Roll on the floor laughing with the actors in this rib-tickling performance that is sure to leave you feeling nostalgic.

Proshows.name: HumorFest
Proshows.description: With the fearful strain that is on me night and day, if I did not laugh I should die. With performances from stand up comedians, one act plays, interactive workshops, clean roasts and what not, Mood Indigo's HumorFest promises to provide top class comedy acts that guarantees to tickle your funny bone! Enjoy quality performances from a spectrum of artists across varying genres in a stress busting environment. Get ready to be entertained by infectious laughter as the comedy artists work their magic of witty and sarcastic puns and one-liners!

events.name: Abhishek Upmanyu
events.description: Standup comedian and internet sensation is known as a writer for On Air with AIB. He is also a co-founder of the popular Twitter handle GareebGuy. A Delhi boy who hardly qualifies to be one (he writes haikus and doesn’t drive a Scorpio), Abhishek Upmanyu is one of the finest young comedians in the country, representing fresh new talent on the scene. Known for killing it on stage, he hurls one cracker of a joke after another, thanks to his Shatabdi-fast delivery, unparalleled observational powers and skilled hands (that help him to write). A hardcore cat lover added to his charmingly shy demeanour is bait to his vast female following. The dark humour and sarcastic comments he unleashes to opine on the current state of affairs is both interesting and amusing, to say the least. Thanks to his quick tongue (he thinks faster than he can speak), many have suggested that he should cut a rap record, but his shy demeanour keeps him from it. The ‘say-it-like-it-is’ comedian started performing in 2013 and recently came out with a brand new show, Thoda Saaf Bol. He took the internet by storm with two simple videos on his YouTube channel. “Breakups, respecting elders and discrimination” and “Indian insults and comebacks”. Abhishek now lives in Mumbai, hoping to scale new heights of success within the comedy and live performance arena.

events.name: Karan Chauhan
events.description:
Get ready for a combination of comedy, gags and illusion as India's first and foremost comedian illusionist Karan Chauhan tickles you into giggles. Combining the magic of comedy and the joy of magic, Karan has enchanted audiences across the globe. A familiar face from shows like the Great Indian Laughter Challenge and MTV reality show - Elevator Pitch, we will never get enough of him! Recipient of awards like Magician of the Year 2015 and Medal of Merlin from International Magicians Society, USA, this act is sure to leave you in splits!
Join us from 27th - 30th December!

events.name: The Shrink & The Nut Session by Atul Khatri & Dr Anjali Chhabria
events.description:
'So many words to say and no way to say them'
Mental strength synced with internal stability counts a lot.
The shrink, Dr Anjali Chhabria is a famous Psychiatrist running her own clinic in Juhu. She also conducts workshops and seminars that help the masses deal with their traumas in life and move on. There isn’t a more right person to help these developing minds cope up with their troubles while also gaining awareness about a healthy mental health.
The nut, Atul Khatri has been a popular face on the television by appearing in advertisements for big brands like- Amazon, Muthoot Finance, Phillips and many more. There couldn’t be a man more apt than him to bring self-awareness in a more relatable and fun way.
The Shrink & the Nut will ensure you can live your life to the fullest, through their unique roadmap. Get a chance to come out of your blues!

Proshows.name: Eloquence
Proshows.description: With every experience, you alone are painting your own canvas, thought by thought, choice by choice, Through LitFest, Mood Indigo attempts to inspire college students by giving them an opportunity to interact with eminent personalities and know their views on a multitude of topics. Be it panel discussions, keynote speakers, poetry sessions or interviews - LitFest has it all. Boasting an elite lineup in the past, with names like Aamir Khan, Shashi Tharoor, Harsha Bhogle, Devendra Fadnavis, Arnab Goswami, this year's LitFest promises to raise the bar and come up with more innovative sessions and great orators!

events.name: Kiran Bedi
events.description:
The literature festival of Mood Indigo hosts the charismatic first woman ex-IPS and highest ranking officer, a social activist and a politician-Kiran Bedi. A former national tennis player and currently the Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry, Kiran Bedi is a force by herself!
She has also been a TV host of Aap Ki Kachehri where she helped to settle real life disputes. And with Navjyoti India Foundation she launched a campaign against drug abuse.
During her tenure she was awarded with numerous trophies and honours, some of which worth mentioning are Suryadatta National Award, United Nations Medal, Mother Teresa Award for Social Justice, Woman of the Year Award, Ramon Magsaysay Award and President’s Gallantry Award
As an inspiration and the best role model to millions of people in India, especially the women, get ready for a tête-à-tête with Kiran ‘Crane’ Bedi on __.

events.name: Chetan Bhagat
events.description:
Eloquence, the literary festival of IIT Bombay hosts one of the leading authors, columnists and motivational speakers of our time, Mr. Chetan Bhagat. His career graph sets an example to the youth of today to passionately pursue their calling. He is an IIT Delhi Alumni who quit his investment banking career to focus more on writing. His novels like Five Point Someone, The Three Mistakes of My Life and What Young India Wants reflected vagaries of growing up years. Mr. Bhagat’s simple and lucid writing have made his books bestsellers and have inspired Bollywood movies some of which are 3 Idiots, Kai Po Che! and 2 States. Time magazine named him one of the most influential people in the world.
Mark your calendar for the 29th of December to listen to his most diversifying journey and get boosted for your very own epiphanous path!

Proshows.name: Afternites
Proshows.description: Entertainment, Entertainment, Entertainment! Bringing the world's most amazing and unique performances promising to leave an everlasting impact, the Afternites at Mood Indigo will ensure the perfect end to the amazing experience that Mood Indigo is. Witness never seen before events which will bring you to the edge of your seats and blow your mind away! You surely don't want to miss the Afternites at Mood Indigo!

events.name: Kupava Light Drawing
events.description: To be filled

events.name: Kua Bo Theater
events.description: Kua Bo started from the campus and proceeded to outdoor environments with the adaptability to different outdoor performing areas.  As a contemporary dance theatre of young generation, Kua Bo cares for Taiwan society and culture via our art and dance.

Proshows.name: Exhibitions
Proshows.description: Exhibitions provide the showcase of unique artforms to the visitors. To all the art lovers out there, this is a real treat. This year, we have a storytelling that walks you through your childhood through a display of pictures, a museum on wheels that takes you through the evolution of currency system in India and what not.

Proshows.name: Night Arena and Night Flee
Proshows.description: After the power packed concerts, this is the event that lets you chill with pretty activities around you and bonfire and food at your service. Join some people while they play soothing music and enjoy the flee market and amazing activities that are in store for you.

Proshows.name: MI Tour
Proshows.description: We target to give all the first timers in MI the experience that they will never forget. We plan to tour them through different events, games competitions and end it with the grandest of them all the Pronites events. Register as a part of MI Tour to get the VIP treatment and experience the best of MI in the 4 days

events.name: TSD Taiwanese Culture
events.description: With an ancient form of culture which offers people peace and prosperity, TSD Culture and Arts Creative team has successfully attracted a huge crowd for young generation's attention in Asia and is here to show the beauty of Taiwanese culture at Mood Indigo 2018. Jia-Jiang (Chinese words for General in ancient time) culture presents the wisdom of Taiwan's tradition of worship, which offers people peace and prosperity, prayers for fortune and disaster relief. TSD street dance group is formed on the basis of supporting this tradition and by adding the latest "hip hop" trend" in the dance through which they have successfully attracted a huge crowd of young generations' attention in Asia.

Competitions.name: Music
Competitions.description:
“Music is the greatest communication in the world. Even if people don't understand the language that you're singing in, they still know good music when they hear it”. 

At Mood Indigo, get a chance to express the musician in you alongside some of the best in the country! From bongos to tablas to drums, from harps to violins to guitars and what not at this year’s Music Competitions at Mood Indigo. Music for the soul searchers and for the head-bangers; we've got it all to revive the melody inside you. With music making its foray through the wilderness of ghazals and khayals, pop and rock, classical and western, and not to forget fusion, we present an experience unprecedented!

events.name: Mantra
events.description: “Most people have just lives; A few lucky ones have music”.  If you have music, team and instruments, and are still waiting, you are just missing the chance to be the next Big Thing in the world of Hindi Rock Bands! The biggest opportunity to introduce yourself as the best Emerging band is on its way! It’s high time you fixed your instruments and enthralled the audience with the eccentric performances! MANTRA gives you and your team, a ‘Mantra’ of success for the rest of your lives! Just train hard and surprise the audience even harder!! Unprecedented Success and glory await you!!
events.rules:
Team Size: 3-8
Rounds: Eliminations, Semi Finals, Finals
Registration: No on-ground slots will be available, all registrations shall be online
Judging Criteria: Quality of vocals, quality of instrumental music, tightness, synchronization, overall impact as a band

Eliminations

  • Participants will have a slot of up to 2 minutes for setup, soundcheck and clearance. Each participant is allotted 5 minutes of performance time.
  • Participants are not required to play an original composition.
  • A drum kit, three microphones and sufficient input lines will be provided on stage.
  • Any other equipment required is to be procured by participants.

Semi-Finals:

  • Participants will have a slot of 15 minutes including setup and clearance. One original composition is required.

Finals:

  • Participants will have a slot of 15 minutes including setup and clearance. One original composition is required.
  • Note: Covers performed in semi-finals cannot be performed in the finals. However, the original composition can be repeated.

General Rules

  • Inter- college participation is allowed but an individual can be a part of only 1 band
  • At least 1 vocalist and 3 instruments required, including 1 percussion instrument compulsory.
  • Songs should only be in Hindi (no other languages allowed).
  • Rap refrains are not allowed.
  • Purely classical numbers are not allowed, however a classical refrain is permitted.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification. The time limit should strictly be followed. Participants will be penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
  • The decision of the organizers regarding the final line-up would be final.
events.subtitle: Hindi Rock Band Competition

events.name: Conchord
events.description: Get ready to bind the audience to their seats with the range of your vocal chords. Human voice never ceases to amaze. Do your vocal chords have what it takes to challenge musical instruments? Can you set the stage on fire? Then Mood Indigo’s Conchord is where you should be! Tap, Clap, Snap, Rap, Harmonize. Your voice has no limits! Be ready to battle it out with the best Acapella groups from all over India! The stage is all yours!
events.rules:
Team Size: 5-23
Rounds: Eliminations, Finals.
Judging Criteria: Quality of vocals, Rhythm, harmonies, tightness, synchronization, overall impact (stage presence)

Eliminations:

  • Teams are required to perform any song(s) of their choice. Songs may be in any language.
  • Time Limit : 4-6 minutes (including setup and clearance)

Finals:

  • Teams are required to perform any song(s) of their choice. Songs may be in any language.
  • Time Limit: 6-8 minutes (including setup and clearance)

General Rules:

  • One vocalist is compulsory.
  • Teams are not allowed to use any instruments.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Time limit should be strictly followed.
  • Participants will be heavily penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • The decision of the organizers regarding the final line-up would be final.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Acapella Competition

events.name: MI Idol
events.description: "If I cannot fly, let me sing!” Man must have asked of God for the gift of voice and words; and the ability to so gracefully decorate his thoughts with language. For the one who sings knows not no boundaries but only the joy of expression - the joy that follows a song felt from the heart and sung from the soul. And nothing then is more beautiful, and nothing then is more enticing. And surely, nothing is more satisfying than singing your heart out loud.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Eliminations, Semi-Finals, Finals.
Judging Criteria: Pitch, Rhythm, Voice modulation (harkate), the overall impact of the song.

Eliminations:

  • Participants will be given a performance time of 2 minutes.
  • No backing music is permitted.
  • Judges reserve the right to stop a participant’s performance at any time.

Semi-Finals

  • Participants will be given a performance time of 4 minutes.
  • Participants must perform with a karaoke track.
  • Karaoke will not be provided, it must be brought by the participant (MP3 format in a pen drive)

Finals

  • Participants will be given a performance time of 6 minutes.
  • Participants can perform with live backing music.
  • Participants may play an instrument themselves OR use one accompanist OR sing over a karaoke track.
  • Song(s) sung in the semi-finals must NOT be repeated in the finals.

General rules

  • Songs must be in Hindi.
  • Songs must not be purely classical, although classical portions or refrains within the song are permissible.
  • Rap portions or refrains are not permissible.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Time limit should be strictly followed.
  • Participants will be heavily penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • The decision of the organizers regarding the final line-up would be considered absolute.
events.subtitle: Hindi Solo Singing Competiton

events.name: Singing The Indigos
events.description: “Then the singing enveloped me. It was furry and resonant, coming from everyone's very heart. There was no sense of performance or judgment, only that the music was breath and food.”        One of the greatest joys and freedoms is to sing what with your heart and soul, it metamorphosizes your thoughts into the listener's mind. Let your songs and voice transcend all the boundaries, sing like you have only today to express yourself, sing for the moment, sing for the laughter and sing for the tears..
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Eliminations, Semi-Finals, Finals.
Judging Criteria: Pitch, Rhythm, Voice modulation, the overall impact of the song (song selection, stage presence etc.)

Eliminations:

  • Participants will have a performance of 1 minute. No backing music is permitted.
  • Judges can stop the performance anytime.

Semi-Finals:

  • Participants will be given a performance time of 4 minutes.
  • Participants must perform with a karaoke track.
  • Karaoke will not be provided, it must be brought by the participant (MP3 format in a pendrive).

Finals:

  • Participants will have a performance time of 5-6 minutes.
  • Participants may play an instrument themselves OR use one accompanist OR sing over a karaoke track.
  • No accompanists will be provided by Mood Indigo.
  • All instruments must be brought by participant.

General rules:

  • Songs must be in English.
  • Rap portions or refrains are not permissible.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Time limit should be strictly followed. Participants will be heavily penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • The decision of the organizers regarding the final line-up would be final.
  • The accompanist MUST be from his/her own college.
events.subtitle: English Solo Singing Competition

events.name: MI’nem
events.description: “Sometimes I feel like rap music is almost the key to stopping racism.” - Eminem  Does your head tap along in sync with the beat, and your words gush out in a chic poetic metre? Rap has something called a beat to it, something that sounds catchy and something you can dance to. To all the underground rappers out there, come out of your ghettos to thrill the audience with your raps! Come and be the MI’nem at MI's very own rap competition!
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Online Eliminations, Finals
Judging Criteria Diction, Clarity of Words, Wit (Creativity, rhyme, etc.), Overall Impact (Attitude, Stage Presence, etc)

Eliminations

  • Register for the event “MI’nem” using your MI number
  • Record a short video of 1-2 minutes, rename it as “<Your MI Number> MI’nem” and upload it on a drive
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
  • Send the link to the video to minem@moodi.org by 10th November. The subject of the mail should be MI’nem <Your MI Number> <Your Name>.
  • Profanity, swears and sexual slangs (at the judge’s discretion) in the rap are not permitted. Else the participant shall be immediately disqualified.

Finals

  • The final round will be in two sub-rounds.
  • In the first sub-round, the participant will get up to 2 minutes to perform any original pre-written rap(s).
  • A copy of lyrics is to be handed over to the organisers at least 30 minutes before the finals.
  • In the final sub-round, the participant will be given a topic to rap on for 2 minutes. He/she can choose from a list of topics. He/she would be given a word at the start of every 20-second interval which is to be incorporated in that interval of the rap.
  • Profanity, swears and sexual slangs (at the judge’s discretion) in the rap are not permitted. Else the participant shall be immediately disqualified.

General rules

  • The language of rap must be only English and/or Hindi.
  • The participants may get any Hip-Hop instrumental(s) / beat(s) (MP3 format in a pen-drive only) of their choice to which they wish to rap (We won’t be providing).
  • The participant is allowed to use puns, double entendres and quips, but any sort of racist, sexist or offensive slurs will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The time limit should be strictly followed.
  • Participants will be heavily penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • The decision of the organizers regarding the final line-up would be final.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Solo Rap Competition

events.name: Surshringar
events.description: Solo Classical Singing
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Online Eliminations, Finals
Judging Criteria: Accuracy of Notes, Rhythm, Selection of Composition, Emotion and overall impact.

Hindustani Vocals:

Judging Criteria: Accuracy of Notes, Rhythm, Selection of Composition, Creativity, Emotion and overall impact
Eliminations:
  • Time Limit: 5-7 minutes
  • The participant shall be asked to perform ONE composition in Dhrutalaya/Madhyalaya with Aalap and Taanas in any raga of his/her choice.
Finals:
Time Limit: 15-17 Minutes The participant may perform any composition(s) in any raga(s) of his/her choice. The performance must include at least one of:
  • Raga Alapana
  • Keerthanam
  • Neraval
  • Kalpana Swaram.

Carnatic Vocals:

Judging Criteria: Accuracy of Notes, Rhythm, Selection of Composition, Creativity, Emotion and overall impact.
Eliminations:
  • Time Limit: 5-7 minutes
  • The participant shall be asked to perform ONE keerthanam/Varnam in a Ragam of his/her choice
Finals:
Time Limit: 15-17 Minutes The participants may perform any composition(s) in any raga(s) of his/her choice. The performance must include a composition in Dhrutalaya/Madhyalaya with Aalap and Taanas.
Any one of these is compulsory
  • Taraana
  • Thumri
  • Bhajan
  • Kajri/Hori
Taraana should be in the same raga as that of the entire performance. You can choose a different raga for Thumri, Bhajan, Kajri/Hori)

General Rules:

  • Strictly no film/folk music allowed.
  • A harmonium, electronic tanpura and a tabla will be provided by the organisers. The performer may use a harmonium or swarmandal if he/she wants.
  • Participants must adhere to the prescribed time limit, else they will be penalised heavily.
  • In finals, the decision to continue with the next composition rests with judges. The judges may bar the participant from continuing if they find that appropriate.
  • Decisions of the judges is final and binding.

To send your online entries:

  • Register for the event “Surshringar” using your MI number
  • Record the video of your performance, rename it as “<Your MI Number> Surshringar” and upload it on a drive
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
  • Send the link to the video to surshringar@moodi.org by 10th November. The subject of the mail should be "Surshringar <Your MI Number> <Your Name>"
  • The performance in the uploaded should strictly satisfy all the above-mentioned rules including time limit and should not contain any details about the participant.
events.subtitle: Solo Classical Music Competition

events.name: Taal Mel
events.description: “Music is the great uniter. An incredible force. Something that people who differ on everything and anything else can have in common.” ? Sarah Dessen         Best things in life come in pairs. Why should music be any different? World has seen some of the greatest melodies when great minds thought alike. Be it soothing melodies of Ravi Shankar-George Harrison or the vibrant tunes of Zakir Hussain- Pat Marino, duets have always enthralled us. Taal Mel, the duet instrumental competition from Mood Indigo gives you the perfect opportunity to display your talents at the biggest stage.
events.rules:
Team Size: 2 (2 instrumentalists are compulsory , NO DRUMS ALLOWED)
Rounds: Online Eliminations, Semi-finals, Finals
Judging Criteria: Accuracy of Notes, Rhythm, Selection of Composition, Emotion and overall impact, creativity.

Eliminations

  • Register for the event “Taal-Mel” using your MI number
  • Record a short video of 3 minutes, rename it as “<Your MI Number> Taal Mel” and upload it on a drive
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
  • Send the link of the video to taalmel@moodi.org by 10th November. The subject of the mail should be "Taal Mel <Your MI Number> <Your Name>".
  • Online entries of upto 3 mins are allowed.
  • Backing tracks are not allowed, audio cannot be processed or altered after recording.
  • Original compositions are allowed but not compulsory.

Semi Finals

  • Participants will be allowed 7 mins onstage (2 mins for setup, soundcheck and clearance and 5 mins for performance).
  • Original compositions are not compulsory.

Finals

  • Participants will be allowed 10 mins onstage (2 mins for setup, soundcheck and clearance and 8 mins for performance)
  • One original composition of atleast 2 mins is compulsory.
  • BONUS: Participants will be given an ‘emotion/theme’ at the start of -2 slot which will have to be depicted through a performance of upto 1 min. This performance will be marked as bonus and is not compulsory.

General rules

  • The decision of the judges will be binding and final.
  • Candidates may be quizzed on any composition played by them if he/she so desires.
  • The time limit should be strictly followed.
  • Participants will be heavily penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • The decision of the organizers regarding the final line-up would be final.
  • No looping or use of processing effects is allowed.
events.subtitle: Duet Instrumental Competition

events.name: Hysteria
events.LYP_description: Get a free course at Point Blank Music London
events.description: “One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.” Let there be war but no pain when the masters of the mood, the creators of the music meet up on a stage to get the party going! The India's biggest war of DJs is here!
events.rules:
Multicity Eliminations

  • Eliminations will be held in Pune, Delhi and Mumbai: Venues to be announced soon

    General Rules
  • Minimum age of the participants should be 17 years
  • Copyright issues are the responsibility of the participant
  • No premixes of Bootlegs allowed
  • Mail your self mixed track of 5-10 minutes at hysteria@moodi.org, exceeding on either side would result in disqualification
  • The DJ mix file should be 192kbps or less. Only mp3 files are allowed
  • Use of controller will not be allowed
  • Once selected, the rules for semi finals and finals will be sent via mail
  • Eliminations & Semi finals of the event will be conducted before Mood Indigo
  • Mood Indigo reserves the rights to disqualification
events.prizes: To be announced
events.subtitle: Semi Professional DJ Hunt

Competitions.name: Dramatics
Competitions.description: “I like the ephemeral thing about theatre, every performance is like a ghost - it's there and then it's gone.”  - Maggie Smith. The adrenaline rush just when you get the cue to mount the stage followed by the satisfaction of creating a stunning performance from a two-line idea. We, at Mood I, believe that dramatics is a way of reinventing yourself. A passion for theatre and a flair for performing is all you need to experience this extravaganza. Acting, directing, script-writing and technicals; whatever your forte; join in for all the action!     From the classy one-act plays to the thrills of street plays, from on-spot improv comedy to the mesmerising beauty of non-verbal theatre, Mood-I, this December can't get more dramatic!

events.name: Third Bell
events.description: It is said that the stage has an energy that takes us on a journey of imagination; an energy that lasts only for a short period of time, leaving behind a stimulating conscience. Third Bell- the stage play competition- gives you the opportunity to immerse the audience in your emotions and actions. The stage is where dreams are born and come true; all you have to do is captivate the audience in a manner like never before!  Having witnessed eminent theatre personalities like Anurag Kashyap, Javed Jafri, Govind Namdev, Piyush Mishra, Virendra Saxena and Himani Shivpuri as judges and mentors, Third Bell has seen its participants scale great heights!
events.rules:
Team Size: 2-10 + 2 CA’s (for lights and sounds) compulsory
Judging Criteria: Acting, Direction, Screenplay and Overall impact

Eliminations

  • Perform a summary of the play or a relevant part bringing out the essence of the play in Hindi/English or both. However, short sub-passages in other languages are allowed.
  • Teams must perform a part of the play that they will perform in the finals.
  • Time Limit:- 9-12 minutes (including setup and clearance time).
  • A warning bell will be given after 11 minutes.
  • The given time duration is from empty stage to empty stage.
  • Teams will be heavily penalised, if the given time limit is exceeded.

Finals

  • Perform an extended version of the same play performed in the eliminations.
  • Time Limit :- 35-45 minutes (including stage setup and clearance time).
  • Production materials provided:- 4 chairs, 2 tables. Any other production material has to be brought by the teams themselves, but the organizers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.

General Rules

  • Only one team per college is allowed.
  • Students from different colleges can team up to participate in the competition but each person can be a part of only 1 play. No one is allowed to be a part of multiple teams. Such inter-college teams need to notify the organisers well before the competition.
  • The above mentioned inter-college teams will be exclusive of the college teams.
  • The number of slots will be limited and will be given on the discretion of the organisers
  • Teams have to mail the Synopsis of their play (not more than 150 words) and Prod List ( List of production material and music instruments brought by the teams) at thirdbell@moodi.org. The subject of the mail should be “College Name_Play Name”. The deadline for submission is 10 December, 2018 11:59 PM.
  • The essence of the play should be brought out in Hindi or English or both. However, short snippets in other regional languages are allowed.
  • Teams will get to perform for a maximum of 50 minutes on stage(including setup and clearance) but they will have to keep an extended version of 60 minutes ready to be eligible for TAP Auditions. Top-3 teams will get to present the rehearsals or script of their 60 minutes play to Thespo Panel post finale for Performance at Prithvi Theatre.
  • Stage play comprises of multiple scenes and may have blackouts.
  • Backstage voiceovers and narrations are allowed during the performance.
  • Pre-recorded music is allowed and should be brought in a pen drive in .mp3 format only. It will not be allowed in any other form.
  • Participants will be provided a laptop and are expected to appoint someone to sit and play during the performance. Music may also be played live.
  • However, no amplifiers or plug points will be provided for this purpose.
  • Participants will be provided a light control box, from which the lighting on the stage can be controlled (Teams need to have a CA for this purpose within team size limit).
  • Any kind of fluids, live animals, flame, heavy and sharp objects or any other material which has a possibility of damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Teams will be heavily penalised if they exceed the time limit. The time limit for both elims and finals includes stage setup and performance time. The given time duration is from empty stage to empty stage.
  • Inappropriate content, blasphemy or content defaming any political party or religious group is strictly prohibited. There should not be any direct implication against anyone.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of judges) of any kind, is not allowed and may lead to disqualification.
  • Junior College Students are strictly NOT allowed.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: One Act Stage Play Competition

events.name: Aagaaz
events.description: In today’s fast-paced world, where people have the average attention span of probably a second, it is highly unlikely that you will be given a chance to make them sit up and hear you out. Well, this is the perfect opportunity. Here, we hit the streets, we sing, we dance, we act, we shout! Our purpose? CHANGE! REFORM! BADLAAV...AAGAAZ!        “Nukkad-Nataks” have been the carriers of change in our country since the very beginning. Haven’t you ever wanted to change the way our country functions? Well, it's time to be the change you want to see! AAGAAZ is all about creating awareness about social problems that plague our soil and bringing about realization in our youth! We have just one thing to say to you-        BE THE CHANGE!
events.rules:
Team Size: 8-20 (Including all music accompanists)
Judging Criteria: Acting(facial expressions, body posture/ movement), Voice (sync, modulation, dictation), Screenplay, Crowd interaction and Overall impact.

Eliminations

  • Teams must perform a part of the street play that they will perform in the finals.
  • Time Limit:- 8-10 minutes (including setup and clearance time i.e. empty stage to empty stage).

Finals

  • Teams must perform an extended version of the same play which they had performed in the eliminations.
  • Time Limit :- 15-20 minutes (including setup and clearance time i.e empty stage to empty stage).

General Rules

  • Teams have to mail the Synopsis of their play (not more than 100 words) and Prod List (List of production material and music instruments brought by the teams) at aagaaz@moodi.org. The subject of the email should be “College Name_Play Name”. The deadline for submission is 10 December 2018, 11:59 PM.
  • The essence of the play should be brought out in Hindi or English or both. However, short snippets in other regional languages are allowed.
  • The team size represents the number of people registered as a team.
  • Only these will be allowed to perform the street play.
  • Only one team per college is allowed to perform in the eliminations.
  • Music accompanists are included in the team size stated above.
  • Teams are expected to perform at the open air venue, on a circular stage with audience on all sides.
  • Any kind of fluids, live animals, flame, heavy objects or any other material which has a possibility of damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Teams will be heavily penalised if they exceed the time limit.
  • Plays can be based on any theme but since eliminations are being held at public venues, inappropriate content, blasphemy or content defaming any political party or religious group is STRICTLY prohibited.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of judges) of any kind, is not allowed and may lead to disqualification.
  • No electrical appliances (for example, amplifiers) shall be allowed during the performance, whether inside or outside the circle of performance. No plug points will be provided for this purpose.
  • You are not allowed to play any recorded music using mobile phones or tapes.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Streetplay Competition

events.name: Jester Fiesta
events.description: "The improv, sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, but when it does, it's like open-field running” - Robin Williams Spontaneity is the essence of this competition, and versatility the limbs on which it rests. In the present world riddled with depression, everyone needs a good laugh. Bring out the comedian in you, tickle the funny bone and make the audience burst into peals of laughter. Be innovative, be creative, be fun and celebrate the JESTER FIESTA.
events.rules:
Team Size: 3-4
Judging Criteria: Acting, Humour, Spontaneity, Screenplay and Overall impact

Eliminations

  • Teams will be a given a choice of 3 theatre games out of which they will have to play any 2.
  • Time limit: 5-7 mins

Finals

  • A choice of 5 theatre games will be given out of which any 3 will have to be played.
  • Time limit: 8-10 mins

General Rules

  • A moderator will be present to control the overall flow of the performance.
  • The moderator holds the power to pause or stop the performance anytime he wishes.
  • No arguments against the moderator will be entertained. His decision will be final and binding
  • No blackouts are allowed.
  • Time Limit should be followed. Participants will be penalized by judges for not doing so. Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Any kind of fluid, live animals, flame, heavy/sharp object or any material which has possibility of damaging the stage is prohibited.
  • No pre-recorded music is allowed.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • You are not allowed to use the technical stuffs provided by us during your chance
events.subtitle: Improv Comedy Competition

events.name: The Chosen One
events.description: The Sole Acting God. Do you have what it takes to get that title. Rhapsodize and win all hearts, all alone. Get the most irrational and erratic idea and taze the audience with it. Fiddle with the hearts and minds of the audience and give them a piece of art to gorge on. Play on with something that is a notch above the other events. Are you The Chosen One?        The Chosen One has seen exceptionally great performances over the years having been mentored one-on-one by eminent theatre personalities like Anang Desai, Deepak Dobriyal, Pankaj Tripathi and Vishal Malhotra. This year, we look for the actor in you!
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo + 2 CAs (for lights and sounds if required)
Judging Criteria: Acting, Screenplay and Overall Impact.

Eliminations (Online)

  • Visit http://moodi.org/ and register for the event “The Chosen One” using your MI number
  • Record a short video of 3-5 minutes, rename it as “<Your MI Number> - The Chosen One”.
  • The video must be recorded from a static camera. Videos having multiple angles/moving cameras are strictly not allowed
  • The size of the Video should not exceed 200MB.
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
  • Deadline for submission: 10th December 2018 11:59 PM (Second lot of eliminations)
To upload your registrations please follow the given steps:
  • On clicking the “Send your Auditions” button under Register Tab, the participant shall be redirected to our audition portal.
  • The participant will be required to fill the following details on the portal:
    • Mood Indigo ID : “Fill in your Registered MI Number in this section”
    • Full Name : “Fill in your Full name in this section”
    • Email id : “Fill in your email id in this section”
    • Mobile Number : “Fill in your mobile number in this section”
  • Once the participant has submitted these details, they will be redirected to Google Play Store/ IOS App Store to download the AIO app. If in case you cancel the downloading or have filled in the details through any other device except your mobile, you must download the app separately on your mobile to submit your auditions on the app.
  • The Auditions can only be uploaded on the App. It is compulsory for the participant to download the App at an initial or later stage in order to upload their entry.
  • Upon downloading the app, to submit your video Go to Dashboard → Theatres Tab (in the top panel) → Mood Indigo → “The Chosen One” → Upload Video
  • Upload your entry in video format and click on ‘Submit’ button. If the video file size exceeds 200 MB, compress the video to shrink its size and upload the compressed file.
  • The fields on the Act It Out app like the time limit, gender, age, etc are certain defaults which the participants need to ignore while uploading the videos. The only restriction is the size of the video which has to be less than 200 MB

Semi Finals

  • Time Limit:- 5-7 minutes
  • The qualifiers of the elims have to produce a valid ID of their respective institutes. Failure to do so will lead to disqualification from the finale round.
  • Use of light-weighted Props is allowed.
  • Any kind of fluid, live animals, flame, heavy/sharp object or any material which has the possibility of damaging the stage is not allowed.

Finals

  • Time Limit :- 7-10 mins
  • Participants qualifying for the finals will be allotted a mentor and will be able to interact with them one on one. They must prepare an act under their guidance and perform it.
  • Use of light-weighted Props is allowed.
  • Production materials provided: 1 chair and 1 table. Any other production material has to be brought by the participants themselves, but the organisers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.
  • Any kind of fluid, live animals, flame, heavy/sharp object or any material which has the possibility of damaging the stage is not allowed.
  • Participants can have live music, however, no amplifiers or plug points shall be provided for the same. Music should be brought in a pen drive in .mp3 format only.
  • Participants will be provided with a laptop and are expected to appoint someone to sit and play during the performance.
  • The time duration for finals includes performance time as well as stage setting time. The given time duration is from empty stage to empty stage.

General Rules

  • The competition is open to all the students with a valid identity card of their respective institutes.
  • Perform a monologue or any solo act of your choice.
  • Miming or ventriloquism is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • The act should be in Hindi or English or both. However short sub passages in other regional languages are allowed.
  • Performance must consist of a single act with no blackouts.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) in any of the stages, of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Use of pre-recorded music and lights will be allowed ONLY in the final round and participants need to have CA’s appointed for the same.
  • Violation of any of the rules will lead to disqualification from subsequent rounds.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Mono-Acting Competition

events.name: Mime Time
events.description: Speak- but not with words!  Share- but not with a dialogue!  Make a point- but not with statements! Do it with your actions!  There was silence, even more of it and then even more. It became eerie. And then the decibel shuddering sound of an applause echoing through the hallowed theatre. We take you back to the times of Charlie Chaplin and Marcel Marceau. Come show off your cute little toothbrush moustache, stitch up your vocal cords, join the leagues of Bip the Clown and be crowned the Chaplin of MoodI.
events.rules:
Team Size: 1-8 (+1 CA for lights compulsory)
Judging Criteria: Acting, Direction, Screenplay and Overall Impact.

Eliminations

  • Participants have to perform a sequence, which can be a mime, pantomime, gibberish*, clowning, juggling in dramatised form or any other non-verbal performance.
  • Time Limit: 4-6 minutes (including setup and clearance time i.e empty stage to empty stage)
    • *Gibberish should not include any recognizable words or meaning implying sounds

Finals

  • Perform an extended version of the same play performed in the eliminations.
  • Time Limit: 8-15 minutes (including setup and clearance time i.e empty stage to empty stage)
  • Production materials provided: 4 chairs, 2 tables Any other production material has to be brought by the teams themselves, but the organizers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.

General Rules

  • Students from different colleges can team up to participate in the competition but each person can be a part of only 1 play. No one is allowed to be a part of multiple teams.
  • The number of slots will be limited and will be given on the discretion of the organisers.
  • Performance may comprise of multiple scenes and hence have blackouts.
  • No dialogue or backstage voiceover/narration of any sort is allowed in the performance.
  • Pre-recorded music is allowed and should be brought in a pen drive in .mp3 format only. However, the music should not contain any kind of recognizable human words in any language. Participants will be provided with a laptop and are expected to appoint someone to sit and play during the performance.
  • Participants will be provided with a light control box, from which the lighting on the stage can be controlled (Teams need to have a CA for this purpose within team size limit).
  • Music may also be played live. However, no amplifiers or plug points will be provided for this purpose.
  • Any kind of fluids, live animals, flame, colour, heavy and sharp objects or any other material which has a possibility of damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Time Limit should be followed. Participants will be penalized by judges for not doing so.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification. The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Non-Verbal Theater Competition

Competitions.name: Dance
Competitions.description: “Dance is for everybody. I believe that the dance came from the people and that it should always be delivered back to the people.”   - Alvin Ailey        Ain’t that right? No matter who watches, just dance and let your soul be free, entering a state of pure ecstasy. Go wild and crazy. Is this not all that dance is about? There is a lil insanity in dancing that does everybody a great deal of good. So loosen up and let the insanity in you take control. Move your body to the groovy beats and fill your vision with crowds cheering for you on stage!  Classical and folk, Hip Hop and Bollywood, Contemporary and Duet- at MI, we have them all! Come, celebrate your panache with our profound Dance Competitions. Are you ready?!

events.name: Desi Beats
events.LYP_description: The first winner of Desi Beats will get a one-day workshop at The Dance Project Studio along with a dance video shoot which will be uploaded from Sony Music India's official YouTube Handle(20 M+ Subscribers). The Dance Project is India’s first original digital dance property for YouTube which gives a common platform to the best of three worlds i.e Bollywood, TV & YouTube to showcase their talent.
events.description:
"  Still have that Bollywood rush racing in your veins?
Does the over-pompous dholak beats and  the throbbing
rock guitars send your legs grooving? Come, spice up 
the stage , scale up the temperature and unhinge the 
crowd with your thumkas and jhatkas! So, go get that 
jhumka and set your pagdi in place because Abhi toh 
party shuru hui hai!      With stars like  Shahid Kapoor, 
Saroj Khan and Mudassar Khan as judges for the past
 years , Desi Beats is going to be as magnificent as 
those Sanjay Leela Bhansali's sets!  "
events.rules:
Team Size: 8-15 + 2 CAs (for lights and sounds) compulsory
Styles: Bollywood
Judging Criteria: Choreography, Energy, Synchronization, Expressions, Stage utilization, Costumes, Innovation in song incorporation and reverse section into performance, Overall impact.
Stage Specifications: Closed Auditorium with the audience on one side of the stage.

Eliminations

  • Teams must perform any sequence of their choice which remains true to Bollywood dance.
  • Time Limit: 3-5 minutes (+1 min setup and clearance time)

Finals

  • Perform an extended version of the piece performed in eliminations.
  • Teams need to add a reverse section where they have to perform a minimum of 15 second part of their choreography in reverse
  • Time Limit: 8-10 minutes (+2 minutes setup and clearance time)
  • Teams can use non Bollywood songs for a maximum of 1 minute in their performance. (Only in finals)

General Rules

  • Only one team per college is allowed.
  • Participants should use more than one songs in their performance.
  • Only Hindi Bollywood tracks are allowed. No regional language or other songs allowed. (Use of any other tracks will result in high penalty)
  • Usage of props is allowed. These have to be brought by the teams themselves but the organizers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.
  • The losses/damage to the props is not the responsibility of organisers and will be heavily penalised
  • Teams are STRICTLY prohibited from mentioning their college names during the performance by any medium. Any team doing so will be awarded high penalty.
  • Teams have to submit their tracks (in mp3 format only) and prodlist at desibeats@moodi.org before 15th December 2018 11:59 PM with subject “College Name | Team Leader's MI number”.
  • Teams are requested to submit their props list prior to the competition and props have to be shown during practice slot. (Props will not be allowed if you fail to show them in practice slots)
  • The soundtrack should also be brought in a pen drive (in .mp3 format only) during Mood Indigo.
  • Any kind of fluid, flame, powders, glitters, heavy or sharp objects or any material which has possibility of tampering/damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Vulgarity and obscenity at any point is strictly not allowed. It can lead to immediate disqualification. Songs should be chosen accordingly.
  • Performers have to clear the stage in the given time after their performance otherwise they will be penalised heavily by the organisers.
  • Violation of any of the above rules, will lead to heavy penalties.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Group Bollywood Dance Competition

events.name: Indigo Saga
events.LYP_description: The first winner of Indigo Saga will get a one-day workshop at The Dance Project Studio along with a dance video shoot which will be uploaded from Sony Music India's official YouTube Handle(20 M+ Subscribers). The Dance Project is India’s first original digital dance property for YouTube which gives a common platform to the best of three worlds i.e Bollywood, TV & YouTube to showcase their talent.
events.description: Who says dance isn't magical? It's time to live your own La La Land. Listen to that long-forgotten whisper and feel the rise and the fall of your breath.Break those shackles. Grab the moment and cast that entrancing spell on us!      Opportunity dances with those already on the dance floor.Come, grab it. Come, dance to live, to breathe, to be free, to be YOU.
events.rules:
Team Size: 8-15 + 2 CAs (for lights and sounds) compulsory
Styles: Contemporary
Judging Criteria: Choreography, Concept and Depiction, Synchronization, Stage utilization, Expressions, Costumes, Overall impact Judges may ask questions regarding the performance and theme (if any) you are depicting
Stage Specifications: Closed Auditorium with the audience on one side of the stage

Eliminations

  • Teams are free to put up any performance.
  • Only Contemporary Dance form is allowed.
  • The performance doesn’t necessarily have to be thematic.
  • Time Limit: 4-6 min (including voice over of maximum 50 secs, +1 min setup and clearance time).

Finals

  • Perform an extended version of the dance sequence performed in the semi-finals.
  • Time limit: 7-9 minutes (including voice over of maximum 90 secs)(+2 mins setup and clearance time)

General Rules:

  • Only one team per college is allowed.
  • Participants may use more than one song in their performance, the length of lyrics (if any) should not exceed 1 mins
  • Relevant voice over(s) is allowed according to given limit: (Eliminations - 50 seconds Semi-Finals & Finals - 90 seconds)
  • Teams are STRICTLY prohibited from mentioning their college names during the performance by any medium.
  • Usage of props is allowed. These have to be brought by the teams themselves but the organizers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.
  • Teams have to submit their tracks (in mp3 format only) and prop list at indigosaga@moodi.org before 15th December 2018, 11:59 PM with subject “College Name | Team Leader's MI number”, mentioning the exact time & duration where lyrical song(s) and voice over(s) have been used in the track.
  • The losses/damage to the props is not the responsibility of organisers and will be heavily penalised
  • Teams are requested to submit their props list prior to the competition and props have to be shown during practice slot. (Props will not be allowed if you fail to show them in practice slots)
  • The soundtrack should also be brought in a pen drive (in .mp3 format only) during Mood Indigo.
  • Any kind of fluid, flame, powders, glitters, heavy or sharp objects or any material which has possibility of tampering/damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Vulgarity and obscenity at any point is strictly not allowed. It can lead to immediate disqualification.Songs to be chosen accordingly.
  • Performers have to clear the stage after their performance otherwise they will be penalised heavily by the organisers.
  • Violation of any of the above rules, will lead to heavy penalties.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Group Thematic Dance Competition

events.name: Double Trouble
events.description: “And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand, They danced by the light of the moon.” ? Edward Lear  Fast. Groovy. Sexy. In-sync.  You rely on physical skills and chemistry, but up until now, that chemistry’s been pretty heterosexual. The time has finally come to break those patriarchal barriers, combat unwitting prejudices and set your souls flying. And oh, that’s not it. Do so with all the chemistry in the world put in 2 souls.
events.rules:
Team Size: 2 +1 (CA for sound if needed) Any two individuals can pair up (irrespective of their gender) to participate in this event. Stage: Circular Stage with audience on all sides.
Styles: Hip-hop, Contemporary or Latin. Participants may perform any styles of Ballroom or Couple Dance from Rumba, Merengue, Samba, Tango, Waltz,Cha-Cha-Cha, Rock 'n' Roll,Jive, Foxtrot,Quick Step, and Paso Doble. Classical and folk are STRICTLY NOT allowed.
Judging Criteria: Synchronization, expressions, Energy level, Stage utilization, Chemistry between the partners, Costumes and props. Innovativeness and creativity which appeals to the judges and the audience will be considered.
Stage Specifications: Circular Stage with audience on all sides.

Eliminations

  • Time Limit: 3-4 mins (+1 min Setup & Clearance time)
  • Judges have rights to stop your performance in between.

Finals

  • Perform an extended version of the dance sequence performed in the Elimination.
  • Time limit : 5-6 mins + 2min (setup & clearance time)

General Rules

  • Participants can be from different colleges, but both should be present college students.
  • All kinds of songs are allowed. Participants may use more than one song in their performance. Even remixes are allowed.
  • Usage of props is allowed. These have to be brought by the teams themselves but the organizers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.
  • Pre-recorded music should be brought in a pen drive in .mp3 format only. Teams must follow the Time Limits and strictly stick to the allowed styles. Teams shall be penalized by organisers for not doing so.
  • Any kind of fluid, flame, powders, glitters, heavy or sharp objects or any material which has possibility of tampering/damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Vulgarity and obscenity at any point is strictly not allowed. It can lead to immediate disqualification. Songs should be chosen accordingly.
  • Violation of any of the above rules, will lead to heavy penalties.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Duet Dance Competition

events.name: Beat the Street
events.description: Come and live your life STEP-UP style , show your talent , your passion for dance ,fulfill your dream to become the best amongst the best ,with hip-hop in your heart, b-boying in soul, crunching in your mind ,tapping in your legs, tutting your hands , and show your rivals that this is your stage , and you are the ringmaster of this arena. Set the streets ablaze with your passion, turn the opposition into mere specks of dust as you weave your way through the patterns of space-time to rise above everyone else and enthrall all who watch to clinch that which all want.        So, are you ready for "The Street Wars"?
events.rules:
Team Size: 5-10 (including all performers)
Styles: Hip-Hop, Popping, Tutting, Krumping, Breakdance, Stepping, Bboying, Contraptions and Western Freestyle. Deviation from hip-hop is discouraged.
Judging Criteria: Choreography, Energy, Synchronization, Stage utilization, Costumes, Innovation, Overall impact, Use of Retro Song in the performance
Stage Specifications: Circular Stage with audience on all sides

Eliminations

  • Teams need to perform a dance sequence incorporating above mentioned dance styles without any theme.
  • Judges have right to stop your performance in between.
  • Time limit: 4-6 min (+1 min setup time)

Semi Finals (Street Dance Battle Round)

  • Participants are expected to prepare themselves for face-off, as no preparation time will be given.
  • The battle round shall consist of 3 rounds.
  • In each round a member from each team or number of members from a team shall enter the battle area and perform their set or throwdown (solo or routines) for a fixed period of time.
  • Once their time is over they will be informed to move from the battle area and let their opponents to enter the battle and perform their set.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Finals

  • Participants should perform an extended version of the dance sequence performed in the eliminations.
  • Teams need to incorporate a RETRO SONG (released before 1985) of minimum 40 seconds in their track.
  • The retro song should be an original Hindi bollywood song, no remix or remakes are allowed.
  • Time limit: 7-9 minutes (+2 mins setup time)

General Rules

  • One person can stay as a member in only one team. Heavy penalty shall be imposed on both teams if this is violated.
  • Crews consisting of participants from mixed colleges are allowed but all members must be present college students (not necessarily from same college).
  • Participants may use more than one song in their performance.
  • Usage of props is allowed. These have to be brought by the teams themselves but the organizers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.
  • Pre-recorded music should be brought in a pen drive in .mp3 format only.
  • Teams must follow the Time Limits and strictly stick to the allowed styles. Teams shall be penalized by organisers for not doing so.
  • Any kind of fluid, flame, powders, glitters, heavy or sharp objects or any material which has possibility of tampering/damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Obscenity of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.
  • Violation of any of the above rules, will lead to heavy penalties.
events.subtitle: Group Hip-Hop Dance Competition

events.name: Nrityanjali
events.description: An eternal art having come from Lord Shiva and Divine Mother Parvati down to the earth to inspire and uplift the suffering human beings, Indian classical dance is meant to please the Divine and to be a powerful means to bring the dancer as well as the audience back to its final destiny, i.e., experience. So drown yourself in divine, grace, beauty, tenderness to delight the eyes and souls of the viewers. Participate in the most graceful competition that Mood Indigo has got for you: The Classical Dancing Competition.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Submission deadline: 23:59, 10th December 2018
Judging Criteria: Nritya (pure dance), Abhinaya (Facial expressions and body language, Footwork, Hand and eye movements), Presentation, Choreography (technical perfection), stage presence, Overall clarity and impact on the audience (Costumes will not be judged in this round)

Eliminations (Online)

  • Visit http://moodi.org/ and register for the event “Nrityanjali” using your MI number
  • Record a short video of 3-5 minutes (including narration time), rename it as “ - Nrityanjali”
  • The video must be recorded from a static camera. Videos having multiple angles/moving cameras are strictly not allowed
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
To upload your registrations please follow the given steps:
  • On clicking the “Send your Auditions” button under Register Tab, the participant shall be redirected to our audition portal.
  • The participant will be required to fill the following details on the portal:
    • Mood Indigo ID : “Fill in your Registered MI Number in this section”
    • Full Name : “Fill in your Full name in this section”
    • Email id : “Fill in your email id in this section”
    • Mobile Number : “Fill in your mobile number in this section”
  • Once the participant has submitted these details, they will be redirected to Google Play Store/ IOS App Store to download the AIO app. If in case you cancel the downloading or have filled in the details through any other device except your mobile, you must download the app separately on your mobile to submit your auditions on the app.
  • The Auditions can only be uploaded on the App. It is compulsory for the participant to download the App at an initial or later stage in order to upload their entry.
  • Upon downloading the app, to submit your video Go to Dashboard → Theatres Tab (in the top panel) → Mood Indigo → “Nrityanjali” → Upload Video
  • Upload your entry in video format and click on ‘Submit’ button. If the video file size exceeds 200 MB, compress the video to shrink its size and upload the compressed file.
  • The fields on the Act It Out app like the time limit, gender, age, etc are certain defaults which the participants need to ignore while uploading the videos. The only restriction is the size of the video which has to be less than 200 MB

Finals

  • The participants who are shortlisted for the finals have to choose any one of the given themes, prepare their own choreography for the same and dance for the chosen theme to only semi-classical and classical instrumental music or song.
  • Time limit : 4 - 7 minutes (including setup, clearance and narration time of 45 sec)
  • Themes : Lord Rama or Lord Krishna, Rivers of India, Colours (any number of colours can be depicted), Five elements of nature ( Jal-Vayu-Bhumi-Aakash-Agni ), Temples of India ( any temple and presiding deity)
  • Judges may ask questions regarding the performance, genre specifications and about the elements/theme that you are depicting.
  • Judging Criteria: Same as Elimination round with Theme incorporation, Costumes, Questions asked by Judges and impact on the audience

General Rules

  • Participants will have to perform any one of the eight classical dances of India. We would love to see Kathak, Bharatanatyam, Kathakali, Mohiniyattam, Manipuri, Sattriya, Kuchipudi, Odissi and Gaudiya Nritya. No other dance form is allowed. However, different forms will not be judged separately
  • The songs should be strictly classical. Film songs are not allowed. [except for the finals, where you can perform on semi-classical instrumental piece].
  • Pre-recorded music should be brought in a pen drive in .mp3 format only. Narration time should not exceed the limit(eliminations - 30 sec and finals - 45 sec).
  • Live music is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • Costumes and accessories are to be arranged by the participants at their cost.
  • Obscenity of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Any kind of fluid, flame, powders, glitters, heavy or sharp objects or any material which has possibility of tampering/damaging the stage is STRICTLY not allowed.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Finals
