  • Teams have to give a small description of their dance form prior to the performance (Can be recorded or verbal). This will be included in your performance time.
  • Teams are STRICTLY prohibited from mentioning their college names during the performance by any medium.

Competitions.name: Design and Digital Arts
Competitions.description: In our era of gadgets and gizmos, we want everything done pronto. Cyberspace has given way to it's tech-Hussains. MI brings to you an attractive platform to showcase your talent, the 21st-century-way. Go insane and come up with the most ridiculous, inexplicable art pieces and feel free to create and innovate! After all, great design is about making other designers feel like idiots because that idea wasn’t theirs. This is the genre that belongs to kind of minds that usually sweep people off their feet with their imagination and the use of it. Here’s your chance to showcase your creativity in designing and innovation events. Go shutter-happy, morph photographs, shoot a movie! In all this, win exciting prizes!

events.name: Cursor Strokes
events.description: “It was a huge challenge to learn digital painting well enough so that computers don't pop into mind when one sees one” - Breathed  So, if you learn the traditional way, it translates over to the digital in a much more painterly way. The only difference being Digital is a lot more forgiving (read: can be easily edited). So if you think you are up to the challenge, start painting… ahm, start digitalising your paintings!
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Direct online finals
Theme: Participants can choose any one or combination of the following themes:
  1. Psychedelic Art
  2. Mirrors and Reflections
  3. Dreams and imagination
Last date for submission: 11:59PM, 10th December 2018
Judging Criteria: Creativity, Quality, Originality, Composition and Layout, Visual Impact

General Rules:

  • This is a digital design competition wherein participants have to design a painting on a software.
  • Participants need to send their work in the .psd, .ai that they have used along with the .jpg file of the same, with at least three stages of work.
  • Participants need to send their entries containing all the above mentioned files in a zipped folder at cursorstrokes@moodi.org with the subject Cursor Strokes: MI-XXX-YYY
  • Only one entry is allowed per participant.
  • No vector/Stock images from online resources to be used.
  • All the entries by the single participant must be sent in one folder. DO NOT send files individually.
  • In a case of multiple entries from the same person, only the first entry will be considered.
  • Any sign of plagiarism may lead to disqualification.
events.subtitle: Digital Painting Competition

events.name: Director’s Cut
events.description: “You shouldn't dream your film, you should make it!” -   Steven Spielberg   We live in a box of space and time. Movies are windows in its walls. They allow us to enter other minds, not simply in the sense of identifying with the characters, although that is an important part of it, but by seeing the world as another person sees it.  Do you often find yourself immersed in this world? Almost everything you experience, somehow finds itself into your projects. Have you ever wondered what would it feel like if this was not only your passion but also your profession?  Mood Indigo ‘17 aims to provide you with the first stepping stone.   Director's Cut has seen it’s participants scale grand heights and achievements, notable among whom is film director Nagesh Kukunoor who has both participated during his college days and judged the competition later.
events.rules:
Team Size: At most 12 in the core team(No particular limit for actors in the film)
Rounds: Online Eliminations and Finals
Judging Criteria: Editing, Cinematography, Script (originality), Acting, Sound effects, overall impact, Relevance to theme(final round)

Eliminations:

  • Time Limit: 3-10 minutes (Including credits)
  • Theme: There is no theme in this round.
  • Deadline for submission: 11th November 2018 11:59 PM

Finals:

  • Finalists will have to make a new short film on a given theme.
  • Time Limit: 5-15 minutes (Including credits and everything)
  • Theme: To be revealed after eliminations
  • Deadline for submission: To be declared!

General Rules:

  • The movie should be in Hindi or English or both. If you choose to make a film in Hindi, it must contain English subtitles. For finals, subtitles are mandatory for movies of both languages. No other languages will be allowed.
  • Please note that Mood Indigo will not be responsible for postal delays, losses or damages. Make sure you send in the entries sufficiently before the deadline. You may use any video camera you deem suitable for shooting the movie. However, we strongly discourage low-resolution cameras, including webcams and mobile-phone cameras.
  • Entries must be the original work of the entrant and must not infringe third-party's rights.
  • The content of the movie should be appropriate for public screening and thus have no vulgarity. Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Please avoid photo animation, slideshows, remixes, spoofs and advertisements.
  • Please note that the teams for the elimination rounds and the finals must be the same. No new addition of members will be entertained.
  • Plagiarism is strictly prohibited.
  • Sound tracks (no max time limit) and stock footage (time limit : max of 1 min 30 seconds) can be borrowed, but with due credits.
  • Teams qualifying for the finals will be asked to submit the scanned copy of their college ID cards along with their photos and their MI numbers.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Submission:

  • Completed movies (accompanied by the name of the college and the MI numbers and details of team members along with their role in the making of the movie) must be submitted in .mpeg or .avi or .mp4 formats only in one of the following ways.
  • Emailing to directorscut@moodi.org with subject of the email to be “Director’s Cut: MI-XXX-YYY / File”
  • Uploading the video on www.youtube.com or any other such website and emailing the link to directorscut@moodi.org with subject of the email to be “Director’s Cut: MI-XXX-YYY / Link”
  • Burning on a CD/DVD and posting* to:
    • Sanjay Khatri, 257, Hostel 7, IIT Bombay
    Powai, Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400076
    *Kindly drop an email to directorscut@moodi.org with the subject of the email to be “Director's Cut: MI-XXX-YYY / Post”, where MI-XXX-YYY is your MI number. The mail should contain the details of the post/courier including the consignment number and date of posting for easy tracking purposes.
  • Note that the size of the file may be too large to email depending on your video clip, and your email provider. In such a case, use one of the other methods.
events.subtitle: Short Film Making Competition

events.name: Framed
events.description: ‘Visual storytelling of one kind or another has been around since cavemen were drawing on the walls’ - Frank Darabont  Taking pictures is savouring life intensely, every hundredth of a second. Life goes on, but a photograph is a memento of that moment. A photograph has the ability to convey emotion, mood, narrative, ideas and messages – all of which are important elements of story telling. We celebrate photography as an art and provide you with the opportunity to compete with the best in this genre and showcase your talent.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Direct online finals
Theme: Participants can choose any one or combination of the following themes:
  1. Psychedelic Art
  2. Mirrors and Reflections
  3. Dreams and imagination
Photo Limit: 5- 15
Last date for submission: 15th December 2018 11:59PM
Judging Criteria: Relevance to theme, Depiction of Story, Composition, Technical Accuracy & Creativity

General Rules:

  • Participants have to depict a story based on the given theme through a series of photos. You can send a PDF file containing title and an overall photo-story description of max 25 words.
  • Camera Resolution should be at least 3.2 megapixels. Photographs must be clicked on a date later than 05-08-2018
  • One without EXIF data (and hence the date) will not be accepted.
  • Make sure that your camera date is set before you click a picture.
  • In photo editing only global editing i.e. cropping and adjustment of hue/saturation; brightness/contrast levels are allowed. Photo-morphing, manipulations or local editing is not allowed.
  • Participants have to submit both the edited and original entries for judging.
  • Participants have to submit an overall description of the photo-story not exceeding 25 words. Individual photo-captions are not allowed.
  • Do not include your credentials (name, address etc), watermarks in the picture or the frame. Such photos will be disqualified.
  • Once the best photo-stories are shortlisted, the concerned participants will be asked to submit scanned copy of their present college ID card.
  • The decision of judges will be final and binding.
  • Any sign of plagiarism will lead to disqualification.

Submissions:

  • Your entry should be in form of a folder named “Framed: MI-XXX-YYY” containing a PDF document for description and serially numbered photos.
  • Any request regarding mistake in your submission will not be entertained.
  • Please mail your entries to framed@moodi.org. The subject of the mail should be “Framed: MI-XXX-YYY”, where MI-XXX-YYY is your MI number.
  • Mails with improper subjects will not be accepted.
  • Entries can also be shared using Google drive by uploading on Google Drive or any other such website and emailing the link to framed@moodi.org with the subject of the email to be “Framed: MI-XXX-YYY / Link”
  • The last date for submission of the same is 25th November 2018

events.name: Snapchat Filter Making Contest
events.description: Snapchat Filter Making Contest
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Eliminations and finals
Deadline: 20th December, 11:59PM

General Rules:

  • The contestant must have a Snapchat account and must also be registered on Mood Indigo’s Website
  • The resolution of the frame must be 1080x2340 (19.5:9 aspect ratio) but at the same time should also be suitable for 1080x2160 & 1080x1920 resolutions in the priority order
  • The only supported format for submission of the filter is .jpg
  • The filter in no form must contain name or the MI-ID of the participant.
  • The entries have to be emailed to snap@moodi.org, the mail should contain both the jpg and the project file in the mail. The subject of the mail has to be “MI-XXX-YYY Name of the participant”
  • The theme of the Filter has to be based on Christmas and there are additional points for the following elements:
    • Surreal elements
    • Mirrors & reflections
    • Illusions

Eliminations:

  • The participants will have to submit the entries on the Mail ID as mentioned above.
  • The Judging criteria would include:
    • Integration of theme
    • Visibility of the elements on different resolutions. (Hey, Notch Notch!!)
    • Logo integration

Finals:

  • Top 3 filters will be selected and will be launched on Snapchat across the country.
  • The winning entry will be decided on the basis of its usage across the country.
  • The finalists can promote their filter by connecting to more and more people and asking them to use the filter.
events.prizes:
Winner gets a prize money of INR 5000 & Snapchat spectacles;
Top 3 winners get Snapchat Swag;
events.subtitle: Snapchat Filter Making Contest

Competitions.name: Speaking Arts
Competitions.description: “Words are, of course, the most powerful drugs used by mankind.” Rudyard Kipling's quote seems relevant in today's age of mass communication. The spoken word today has immeasurable power. Throughout the ages, it has inspired noble dreams and motivated memorable deeds. Oratory genius has been the hallmark of great personalities. Nothing else is more influential than delicately directed sentences. And what does all of this require? No stage, instrument or tools - just you and your voice! This MI, get an opportunity to mould opinions, shape discourses and sway emotions like never before with a variety of competitions ranging from poetry and stand-up to GDs and Extempores! Come - Speak - Conquer!

events.name: Humor Us
events.LYP_description: The top-3 winners of Humor Us - the stand up comedy competition, will get a special chance to perform at Canvas Laugh Club's Laughter Launchpad - a perfect platform to start your professional Stand up career. The show will have a professional host and will be headlined by a Best in Stand up artist.
events.description: You walk onto the stage and your heart beats louder. You know you have to deliver, something big! Face the audience, their anticipation, weariness and demand and leave them with a gratified smile only and only through your words. Stand-Up Comedy is considered to be one the most difficult thing to create and perform. Do you think you have what it takes? Are there times when all you can think about is how to make the situation funny? Do you consider Steve Martin and Russell Peters to be your idols? It’s not easy to go on stage and have people laugh at you, but if nothing thrills you more, then this competition is for you!
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Eliminations & Finals
Judging Criteria Content, Quality of humour, Stage presence, Audience engagement, Clarity of thought, Wackiness, USP (Unique selling point)

Eliminations

  • Eliminations are to be conducted on-ground during the fest, where the participants have to put on a show of 3-4 minutes in front of a live audience.

Finals

  • The participants who cleared the eliminations will be asked to prepare a sketch of maximum 5 minutes, to perform in front of a live audience.

General Rules

  • Mono -acting, puppetry, musicals are not allowed though ventriloquism is allowed.
  • Use of props is allowed, brought in by the participant himself.
  • The organisers hold the discretion of allowing it on stage.
  • Both English and Hindi are allowed. No other language is allowed.
  • Decisions taken by the judge is absolute and binding.
  • Use of obscenity/profanity (at the discretion of the judges) is not allowed and there should be no direct implications.
  • Any Form of music is not allowed during the performance.
  • Since the participants are called upon in a random order, each is required to be present at least 5 minutes prior to the start.
  • Organisers will not be responsible if you are unable to show up on time and miss your slot.
events.subtitle: Stand-Up Comedy Competition

events.name: Kavyanjali
events.description: Hindi Poem Recitation Competition
events.rules:
• Team Size: Solo
  • Rounds: Eliminations and Finals

On - Ground Eliminations

  • Participants are to recite a poem in front of a live audience, either from memory or reading from a paper.
  • Time Limit: 2-3 minutes

Finals

  • Time Limit: 6-10 minutes
  • Note: Shayari is not allowed.
  • Participants can recite any number of poems in hindi (including at least 1 original poem that was recited in the elimination round) in front of an audience, and engage the crowd as they find suitable.
  • Judging Criteria: Content, Delivery, Language, USP (Unique Selling Point) and Overall Impact.
  • Rules and Regulations: The poems must be in Hindi only. No other languages will be allowed. Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed. Time Limit should be followed. Participants will be heavily penalized by judges in case of exceeding the time limit. The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Hindi Poem Recitation Competition

events.name: Poetry Slam
events.description: “You're never going to kill storytelling because it's built into the human plan. We come with it.” - Margaret Atwood  They say storytelling is awe-inspiring, we say it's just too mainstream. So why not do something different. Poetry Slam is an event where you are going to tell a story neither will you be reciting poems, but doing both simultaneously, because one does not simply do one thing at a time. Now it's your obligation to take the audience on a heart-rendering, emotional, beatific or a hilarious journey and keeping them engaged throughout.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Oline Eliminations & Finals
Submission Deadline: 31st October 11:59 PM
Judging Criteria Audience reaction and engagement, Depth of Content, Voice and articulation ( Intonation, rhythm, pronunciation), USP (Unique Selling Point), Body language, Overall impact.

Eliminations (Online)

  • Visit http://moodi.org/ and register for the event “Poetry Slam” using your MI number
  • Record a short video of 2-3 minutes, rename it as “ Poetry Slam”
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
  • Video has to be shot from a static angle and with a single camera strictly
  • Eliminations will not be conducted during Mood Indigo
To upload your registrations please follow the given steps:
  • On clicking the “Send your Auditions” button under Register Tab, the participant shall be redirected to our audition portal.
  • The participant will be required to fill the following details on the portal:
    • Mood Indigo ID : “Fill in your Registered MI Number in this section”
    • Full Name : “Fill in your Full name in this section”
    • Email id : “Fill in your email id in this section”
    • Mobile Number : “Fill in your mobile number in this section”
  • Once the participant has submitted these details, they will be redirected to Google Play Store/ IOS App Store to download the AIO app. If in case you cancel the downloading or have filled in the details through any other device except your mobile, you must download the app separately on your mobile to submit your auditions on the app.
  • The Auditions can only be uploaded on the App. It is compulsory for the participant to download the App at an initial or later stage in order to upload their entry.
  • Upon downloading the app, to submit your video Go to Dashboard → Theatres Tab (in the top panel) → Mood Indigo → “Poetry Slam” → Upload Video
  • Upload your entry in video format and click on ‘Submit’ button. If the video file size exceeds 200 MB, compress the video to shrink its size and upload the compressed file.
  • The fields on the app like the time limit, gender, age, etc are certain defaults which the participants need to ignore while uploading the videos.

Finals:

  • The participants who cleared the eliminations will be asked to prepare a poem to perform in front of a live audience, either from memory or reading from a paper.
  • Time Limit: 4-5 minutes

General Rules:

  • The poems must be an original composition in English.
  • Poetry which isn’t slam poetry will be disqualified.
  • The poems performed in the eliminations and finals must be different.
  • No props, costume or musical instruments including overly dramatic clothing are allowed.
  • All styles are welcomed and encouraged. Whatever you would have fun doing!
  • The decision taken by the judge is absolute and binding.
  • The scorekeeper keeps track of the length of the performance.
  • If the poem goes longer than allotted minutes, there’s a ten second grace period, after which the poet will suffer a penalty.
  • Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed.
  • Since the participants are called upon in a random order, each is required to be present at least 15 minutes prior to the start.
events.subtitle: English Slam Poetry Competition

events.name: Speak Up
events.description: For those who don't merely speak but, assert  For those who don't just carry an opinion but, stamp it  For those who don't just have a say but, deliver the verdict.  If you have the gift of the gab, we present before you a stage and a worthy opponent. Be warned. The competition is fierce, and the stakes high. String together articulate words and deftness of the rational mind, and victory is yours. Fail to do so, and you are the pawn in the game.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Eliminations and finals
Rules:
  • Language of presentation is English
  • Participants have to prepare both for and against the motion/topic.
  • Topics will be given well in advance
  • Participant has to speak for a total of 4 minutes.
  • They may begin with a stance of their choice but have to switch once the judge taps/bangs. There may be more than one tap, which means participants may have to switch more than once and must continue speaking until the time of 4 minutes is up.
Judging Criteria: Content, Stage Presence, Voice articulation, Spontaneity, Wit & Humor. The team with the most relevant points and counter-arguments will win.
events.prizes: 1st Prize:  7000 INR;  2nd Prize:  4000 INR;  3rd Prize:  2000 INR;
events.subtitle: Turncoat Debate Competition

events.name: Just a Minute
events.description: Just-A-Minute (or JAM) is an all-round fun event that is all about the control of the mind over the mouth. Can you make it through sixty seconds of non-stop talking without hesitation, repetition, or deviation? Or will the sheer pressure make you crumble and have your competitors pounce on you in an instant?
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Registration: On-ground slots will be available, preferred if you register online.
Round(s): Eliminations (may be more than one) and finals
Judging Criteria: Content, Spontaneity, Diction, Wit, Humour, Originality, and Overall Impact.

General:

  • Solo Competition in which the participants are invited to speak on the spot, in rotation, for one minute on a given subject in English, without "hesitation, repetition or deviation".
  • A panellist scores points for making a correct challenge (concerning repetition or deviation) against whoever is speaking, or the speaker gets a point if the challenge is deemed incorrect.
  • A player who makes a correct challenge takes over the subject for the remainder of the minute, or until he or she is successfully challenged.
  • The person speaking at the moment the whistle blows (after 60 seconds) also scores a point.
  • Extra points will awarded if a panellist speaks for the entire minute.
  • Any obscenity will lead to disqualification. The final decision is based on the discretion of the JAM Master and the organising committee.

Eliminations:

  • Participants will be divided into groups and only one from each group makes it to the next round.
  • Participant with the highest score (winner) from each group will move to the next round.
  • No variations will be introduced.

Finals:

  • Random variations will be introduced on the spot before each round.
  • For example; Prohibition of the use of the word “is”.
events.prizes: To be Announced;
events.subtitle: English Extempore Competition

Competitions.name: Fine Arts
Competitions.description: "Art is the only way to run away without leaving home."         Do you spend lectures doodling in your notebook and have a knack for bringing to life with those colors, a Kodak moment? Do you think out of the box and explore the very frontiers of human creativity?  Lose yourself and drown in the colours of the world. Create that which cannot be explained but only experienced. An artist would not be an artist if the world appeared normal. With a plethora of unique competitions like 3-D Painting, Doodling, Sketching, Painting and Rapid Rounds, Fine Arts at Mood Indigo is where you’re restricted only by the boundaries in your own mind!

The canvas has necessarily changed from the school bench or last pages to the home page of the global behemoth , Google. In an art form, often dismissed as indulgence of an idle mind, MI shouts out to all the back-benchers out there, rekindle the child inside, get out and moodle...er..I mean doodle!

Competitions.description: "The limits of my language are the limits of my world" - Ludwig Wittgenstein         Come home to the Mecca of the Literary Arts, where the finest compete and the wittiest set standards! We stage them all, from nail-biting grand quizzes to witty events like creative writing, mind boggling word games and spelling competitions. All that’s needed to blunt your sharp wits and show you, you’re never good enough!   Intelligence, knowledge, creativity, spontaneity, linguistic proficiency - just a few tools in a learned man's toolbox. Unleash the power of your brain as you walk through the crafty maze of Literary Competitions at Mood Indigo.

You know more than you think you do.’ - Trust your instinct, use your knowledge and awareness and aim for victory. Be there, at Mood Indigo, to experience the joy of working out a question from scratch, the disappointment when you get it wrong and that epic feeling of being crowned champion! Be there to fight it out to be India’s best college-quizzer!

events.description: “Was it a car or a cat I saw ?” Did your keen eyes spot the palindrome? Do you spend your Sunday afternoons brooding on the cryptic crosswords? Are puns and puzzles your favourite pals? Then Mood Indigo brings the perfect panacea for your hunger for wordplays, in the form of Wordemort, the word games competition. Get ready to test your wits and try out your skills on the biggest stage in India. The wordsmith within you awaits to unleash itself come December.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: 2 (Eliminations followed by finals)
Reference Link: https://litwar.wordpress.com

  • Both rounds involve creative and interactive word games.

events.name: Spell-Bound
events.description: Does the mere sight of a dictionary set your heart pounding, your head throbbing? Do you always ensure to change your last ‘y’ to an ‘i’ before adding a suffix, unless of course, it begins with an ‘i’. Do you consider yourself a spelling veteran or are you just a novice looking for fun. Well, either way, this is the best place for you to be. Come participate in the Mood Indigo spelling competition and have an exhilarating.. er.... I mean exhilarating experience!
events.rules:
Team Size: Team should consist of two people, across any college.
Rounds: 2 (Eliminations followed by finals)

Eliminations:

  • The eliminations will consist of a dictation round where 25 words will be given to participating teams to spell and write in the sheets given to them.
  • The fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth and twenty fifth words will be star marked words, used for breaking ties and carrying twice the amount of marks as the non-star-marked words.

Finals:

  • The finals will have 4 rounds in total.
  • Format will be communicated on the spot.
  • Finalists will have to be present at the venue right on time or else they will disqualified immediately.

General Rules:

  • The UK dictionary will be followed i.e. the Queen's English shall be spoken and spelt.
  • In case of homophones, both spellings will be accepted.
events.subtitle: Spell Bee

events.name: Pen-Tastic
events.description: If creativity for you is integral to your existence. If words for you are an expression of your soul. If the pen is a gateway to your imagination. And if your hand-crafted fantasies mesmerize all and sundry, then creative writing at Mood Indigo is for you. Pentastic is a platform where your dreams take flight. Where your prowess as a master wielder of the ink stirs the melancholic soul. Where magic takes the form of the written word.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Direct Online Finals
Topic: Is it possible to glorify an artist (that has been accused of sexual misconduct) for their work and hold them accountable for their actions at the same time?
For example, should we continue to idolize famous comic book writer/publisher Stan Lee, who has been recently accused of sexual battery and misconduct, for his genius, or should we stop consuming his work lest it should trivialize the impact of his actions on the victims?
Put forth points for and/or against...
Word Limit: Not more than 1000 words.
Submission Deadline: 11:59 PM, 10th December 2018
Judging Criteria: Originality of Idea, Execution of Idea and incorporation of Theme, Language (Literary devices, vocabulary, grammar e.g. subject-verb agreement), Narrative Structure

Rules pertaining to Literature:

  • The competition is held in the English language alone.
  • The genre of literature can be - fiction, non-fiction or a coalescence of both.
  • Forms of literature can be - Short story (No Novelette shall be entertained), Monologue, Narrative. Inclusion of an abstract and short poetry to convey ideas is allowed subject to the condition that the entry should essentially be a prose.
  • Plagiarism (From a copyrighted work OR an internet publication e.g. WordPress blogs/wattpad blogs) would lead to an immediate disqualification, however, block quoting is allowed in nonfiction genre.
  • Content should not be defaming/abusive towards any community, person or place, however, individual opinions can be stated with decency and decorum.
  • Abusive, obscene or exorbitantly erotic content will be immediately disqualified.
  • Any form of illustration (graph, photograph, hand sketch) is not allowed.

Rules pertaining to Submission:

  • Submission deadline: To be declared
  • Entries must be submitted as typed word documents/PDF files to pentastic@moodi.org subject of the email to be "Pentastic: MI-XXX-YYY", where MI-XXX-YYY is your MI number.
  • Photographs of handwritten entries or scanned copies of entries will not be entertained.
  • The entry has to be a previously unpublished work.
  • Only one entry per contestant is valid.

Competitions.name: Lifestyle
Competitions.description: Every day we do little things that require skills. These unsung activities get lost in the more artistic of skills. Not anymore. Mood Indigo pledges to take culture and art beyond the regular. Presenting Lifestyle and Sports at Mood Indigo – where living and playing becomes an art!       This is the place where you get to show off your personality traits that you quietly praise yourself for every time you look in the mirror or present yourself to the crowd. Here you can let flow your hidden talents, be it your charm and personality, your competence in the kitchen, your freestyle soccer or your blogging skills! How you look and how you carry yourself – all of this is a part of human culture. Then why not incorporate them! Hence, Lifestyle and Sports!   Try out the plethora of competitions lined up for you, win exciting prizes and have the time of your life!

events.name: Vogue
events.LYP_description:
Best Designer:
  • A cash prize of INR 20,000
  • Designer's outfit collection photoshoot by leading photographer Jatin Kampani
  • Would feature in a post by Anima Creative Management as a winner
Best Model:
  • A cash prize of INR 12,000
  • A portfolio shoot by leading Indian fashion photographer Subi Samuel
  • Casting opportunity at the Anima Creative Management agency
  • A portfolio shoot by one of the leading talent management firm Anima Creative Management
  • Would feature in a post by Anima Creative Management as a winner
All the participating models get a chance to win an international modelling contract by leading talent management firm Anima Creative Management which is one of the agencies which people dream of joining. Here's a link to their website: http://animacreatives.com/
events.description:
“I don’t do fashion, I am Fashion!” – Coco Chanel
Fashion is an art, a religion, a peek into a personality. For some, it’s an escape or a disguise while for others it’s just being comfortable. But ultimately, fashion is an individual statement of expression for each of us and VOGUE is the avenue to express yourself. Boasting of a decade-long legacy, the “gloss, glitz and glamour” is back with bigger and better stakes. Having witnessed eminent industry frontrunners like Ritu Kumar, Anita Dongre, Neeta Lulla, Wendell Rodricks and Dabboo Ratnani as judges and mentors, VOGUE has seen its participants scale grand heights and achievements, notable among whom are Miss India World 2008 Parvathy Omanakuttan and famous Bollywood actress Hrishita Bhatt. VOGUE is your chance to emerge as a trendsetter in front of the big guns of trade and a huge, ecstatic audience!


Register at www.moodi.org/vogue | Last date for registration: 15th October 2018
Note: The Team Leader has to register on the behalf of the whole team
Crossover teams can be formed between students of different colleges

Last date for online submission of designs and write-ups: 20th October 2018
The Final Stage round would happen on 27th December'18 at Mood Indigo, IIT Bombay
For any queries contact animesh@moodi.org
events.rules:
TEAM SIZE:
  • Designers:1-4
  • Models: 8-14
  • Choreographer: 1
  • Makeup Artists: 1-4 (excluding the models)


THEME DESCRIPTION:

THEME | From Reverie to Reality “Weaving fantasies”
ADDITIONAL ELEMENT | At least 2 outfits MUST feature BODITECTURE (Convertible fashion construction)

“A sole fantasy can transform endless realities."

Fashion, is the manifestation of a fairytale, an embodiment of fantasies. It is about metamorphosis, about transforming yourself to play a part that other people behold.

Fashion is all about the surprise, the enigma and the fantasy. As unrealistic as fairy tales are, there always exist realities that we can translate into our own fantasy. A potential reality that keeps us interested. A fantasy we desire.

Fantasy represents transcendence. Wandering into a dimension that lies beyond the reach of time and space. It is as diverse as our imagination. One thing that transforms the princess within you or the mermaid within you into a tangible reality is precisely, Fashion.

If we think about it, fashion is like a dream. It’s sometimes surreal and often fantastical. It’s where anxieties and aspirations play out, and the worst and best parts of our personalities become magnified.
Rules do not apply.

But of course, Vogue is real and clothes are made of fabric, thread and hard work.
Not cosmic stardust and magic... So come and work your magic through your designs. The possibilities are boundless.

Every designer fantasizes and every fashionista dreams of showcasing these fantasies through their talent. Vogue provides an opportunity to showcase on the very theme of fantasy.

Come, transform your fantasies into reality. Maybe your reality into a fantasy.
Personify your imagination.
Ignite other people.
Have the stage to yourself and embrace your biggest FANTASY.


JUDGING CRITERIA:
  • Designers: Theme Originality, Depiction of Theme, Designing, Use of Props and Accessories, Use of fabrics
  • Models: Ramp walk, Stage Presence, Poise, Overall Appearance
  • Team: Choreography, Music and Narration, Co-ordination, Relevance to the theme, Overall Performance

DEADLINES:
  • Last date for registration: 15th October 2018
  • Last date for online submission of designs and write-ups: 20th October 2018

STRUCTURE:
The competition comprises of two elimination rounds and one on-stage round. The stage round would be themed, wherein the teams have to design their creations based on a common theme.

1st ELIMINATION ROUND: For the eliminations, designers have to mail the following to Vogue@moodi.org:
  • A soft copy of their designs for the stage round
  • Write-ups explaining their designs for the stage round
  • The portfolio of any three models who would participate
  • The designers need to present at least 8 and a maximum of 14 dresses which will be based on this theme. Each set of design can have multiple numbers of accessories.
Note: Only the designs submitted during this round will be allowed to be worn by the models in the stage round. Thus the submission should necessarily include the designs for the stage round. The first round of eliminations shall be based on the above-listed submissions.

2nd ELIMINATION ROUND: The teams selected after round 1 will be required to send the portfolios along with photo IDs of all the models who will walk the ramp during the stage round. The 2nd round of eliminations will be based both on the designs and these portfolios. The team leader is advised to be ready with at least 8 models before by the time of deadline of 1st elimination round.

STAGE ROUND: The selected teams will perform at Mood Indigo on 27th December 2018. The judging criteria has already been mentioned above. For more information, read the general rules listed below.
  • Time Limit: 7 minutes per team (empty stage to empty stage)
  • Number of Models: 8-14 models

GENERAL RULES:
  • Vogue is open only for college students
  • There can be multiple teams from a single college
  • Crossover teams can be formed between students of different colleges, all having valid college ID cards for the current year
  • Time Limit: 7 minutes per team (empty stage to empty stage)
  • Teams can ask for assistance from people outside the college such as choreographers, make-up artists, but these professionals will not be considered to be a part of the team
  • Vulgarity of any kind would lead to disqualification of the team from the event. Hence, if the team feels that any stunt or costume design can be considered vulgar, it is strongly advised to consult the organizers before displaying it on stage. The decision of the organizers will be final in case of any disputes arising due to this
  • Teams are suggested to inform the organizers of any kind of props they are planning to use. Use of water, fire, pets or any hazardous materials is not allowed. Teams are instructed to consult with the organizers before using any such material
  • Teams are instructed to send the soundtrack/music to be used during their performance to the organizers through mail at least a week prior to the event
  • Vogue being one of the flagship events of Mood Indigo, will be using professional lights brought in from outside. It would be best for the teams to inform the organizers of their light requirements in advance
  • No branding on clothes will be allowed. Sponsors of colleges will be given compere mentions only
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding on all
  • The Portfolio shoot shall be offered only to the best model, independent of overall winners and the same applies for best designer. Division of cash prizes and Designer outfit shoot is at the sole discretion of the team and the registered designer shall act as a liaison between the team and Mood Indigo. The recipient of the Designer outfit collection photoshoot, in case of the best designer, will have to be pre-informed to Mood Indigo
  • The recipient of portfolio shoot and Designer outfit shoot need to drop an acceptance mail within one week of being informed by the organizers
  • No animals or birds should be harmed in the making the designs. Doing so will lead to immediate disqualification
events.subtitle: Fashion Designing Competition

events.name: Trashion
events.description: You have competed in that evergreen Best-out-of-the-waste competition. No big deal, everyone participates in that when they are 10. So why not give it just another shot, however, yes, there’s always a catch in such situations. So cutting out all the cliched stuff we bring you a fashion designing competition with a twist, where you must produce a dress out of garbage!  Just a li’l advice, choose less stinky material coz you’re gonna wear it.
events.rules:
Team Size: 2 - 4
Rounds: Single Round: Make an apparel (clothing or outfit which includes accessories/equipment worn or carried in a function) out of material which is normally thrown out as waste. Participants will have to make an outfit depending on the theme (which would be given on the spot) using the materials given.
Judging Criteria: Intelligent use of materials, Creativity, Overall appeal of dress and colour composition.

General Rules:

  • We will be providing teams with some material like newspaper, paper cups, glue, etc.
  • Teams can make their dress using these materials only.
  • No material (fresh/waste) is allowed to be used which is brought from outside the campus.
  • At the end of 4 hours, one of the team members shall wear the dress.
  • The decision of judges shall be final and binding.
events.subtitle: Fashion with Trash Competition

events.name: She's Got the Look
events.LYP_description:
Get a chance to feature in the finals of Bombay round of Femina Miss India

Winner gets 1 year contract to model for Liva!
*Contract deliverables may change at the discretion of Liva’s team
events.description: Be a Super Diva! Incoherent chatter prevailed as the audience waited for the curtains to unveil what was behind them. Everyone waited anxiously for the great masterpiece to be revealed. Amidst the hustle and bustle, the curtains slowly drew apart. And then there was silence. Everyone was starstruck by the angelic beauty that stood on stage. She exuded an ethereal aura, almost surreal, like a beam of sunlight cutting through the darkness. As she walked, the rhythmic click of her heels was the only sound that domineered. Her eyes shone brightly and as her lips curved into a radiant smile the spectators were spellbound. Her glossy hair flowed in sync with the melody that played behind, hypnotizing them. At She’s Got Look this is what beauty is all about. This is a competition tailor-made for all of you who ever aspired to be the next glamorous diva. If you think you have what it takes to mesmerize an audience with your presence and if beauty is your strong forte this competition is just for you. Come set the stage on fire with your charm and charisma at Mood Indigo 2018.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Rounds: Online Eliminations and Finals(Ramp Walk and Q&A)
Judging Criteria: Beauty & Personality

General Rules:

  • Particpant must be a college student and must be 18-25 years of age as of December 31, 2019
  • Particpants must have a height greater than 5'5" without heels
  • Particpants will have to send their portfolios to sgtl@moodi.org in PDF format
  • The subject of the mail must be as follows: 'SGTL | MI-ABC-xxx'
  • Participants must include the answer to the question-'What does fluidity mean to you?'. This answer must be present at the end of the portfolio PDF
  • Word Limit of the answer for the above-stated question is 100 words
  • The best answer might get a chance at Wild Card entry in the finals of the competition
  • There can be multiple participants from the same of college
  • Dress Code: Black Cocktail dress and stilettos
  • Any incorrect information will lead to immediate disqualification irrespective of being discovered prior to, during or after participation
events.prizes: Get a chance to feature in the finals of Bombay round of Femina Miss India

events.name: Mr And Ms Mood Indigo
events.LYP_description:
Prizes worth INR 40,000 at stake
Get direct entry to the Bombay finale of Times Fresh Face
events.description:
Long ago, tribes used daring feats of skill and bravery to choose the worthiest amongst them. To be welcomed to the tribe you, too, must impress the Headman with your... eh, skills, for lack of a better word. Hilarity ensues when one is asked to charm the ladies and win over the men over the competition, but you’ve got to do what you’ve got to do! Amongst the tribes, the notions of “Survival of the fittest” get redefined.


Bottomline : Be the stand-out person at Mood Indigo 2K18.
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo
Judging Criteria: Personality, Stage Presence and Overall Impact.

Eliminations (Online)

  • Visit http://moodi.org/ and register for the event “Mr. & Ms. Mood Indigo” using your MI number
  • Record a short video of your talent of 2-3 minutes, rename it as “<Your MI Number> - Mr. & Ms. Mood Indigo”.
  • The video must be recorded from a static camera. Videos having multiple angles/moving cameras are strictly not allowed
  • The size of the Video should not exceed 200MB.
  • Note that the video should not be edited in any way. Use of any kind of special effects is STRICTLY prohibited and will lead to direct disqualification
  • Deadline for submission: 10th December 2018 11:59 PM
To upload your registrations please follow the given steps:
  • On clicking the “Send your Auditions” button under Register Tab, the participant shall be redirected to our audition portal.
  • The participant will be required to fill the following details on the portal:
    • Mood Indigo ID : “Fill in your Registered MI Number in this section”
    • Full Name : “Fill in your Full name in this section”
    • Email id : “Fill in your email id in this section”
    • Mobile Number : “Fill in your mobile number in this section”
  • Once the participant has submitted these details, they will be redirected to Google Play Store/ IOS App Store to download the AIO app. If in case you cancel the downloading or have filled in the details through any other device except your mobile, you must download the app separately on your mobile to submit your auditions on the app.
  • The Auditions can only be uploaded on the App. It is compulsory for the participant to download the App at an initial or later stage in order to upload their entry.
  • Upon downloading the app, to submit your video Go to Dashboard → Theatres Tab (in the top panel) → Mood Indigo → “Mr. & Ms. Mood Indigo” → Upload Video
  • Upload your entry in video format and click on ‘Submit’ button. If the video file size exceeds 200 MB, compress the video to shrink its size and upload the compressed file.
  • The fields on the Act It Out app like the time limit, gender, age, etc are certain defaults which the participants need to ignore while uploading the videos. The only restriction is the size of the video which has to be less than 200 MB
events.prizes: Prizes worth INR 40,000 at stake
events.subtitle: Personality Hunt Competition

Competitions.name: Journalism and Communication
Competitions.description: “In America, the President reigns for four years, and Journalism governs forever and ever.” -Oscar Wilde      Journalism can never be silent: that is its greatest virtue and its greatest fault. It must speak, and speak immediately, while the echoes of wonder, the claims of triumph and the signs of horror are still in the air. Going beyond the horizons to search for the untapped, creating a lexicon of words that convey the most hidden facts, stating the obvious in the most ostentatious manner, speaking all but truth. Sorry, news, nothing but the news!  Not to forget communication, which has something for everyone! Come, be a part of these novel and improved competitions in the field of mass media which would have you diving to the depths of cases, investigating various scenarios and presenting your conclusions before professionals of that very field!

events.name: Radio-Active
events.description: Do you associate radio with masti fata-fat ? Are you always khush because you are a   mirchi sunnewala? Are 98.3 and 92.7 the only numbers you can associate with the word BIG? Does everyone around you run for cover when you start your own encore of  Kamla ka Hamla  ? Then throw in your speaking hat and slug it out in a competition against loads of other contenders to get the title of “Genuine Jockey”. A few intense to test your wit, creativity and spontaneity are all that stand in your way to claim the prize.
events.rules:
• There will only be limited number of participants.
  • Registration for which will be on a first come first serve basis, through the website.
  • There will be two rounds to the competition, eliminations and finals.
  • Medium of communication will be Hindi or English.
  • The participants will be judged on the basis of fluency, spontaneity, presentation, sense of humor, communication skills, interaction with the listeners and a strict adherence to the time limit.
  • Decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Eliminations

  • Topics will be given 5 minutes in advance
  • Each participant will be given 2 minutes to speak

Finals

  • Topics will be given 15 minutes in advance
  • Each participant will be given 3 minutes to speak
events.subtitle: Radio Jockey Competition

events.description: Going beyond the horizons to search for the untapped, stating the obvious in the most ostentatious manner, speaking all but truth, sorry news, nothing but the news!        This year, test your skills as a journalist, give people the concise information of what they need to hear and become the part of this new culture, only at MI! The competition will be held in three rounds testing skills in almost all spheres of journalism. Teams who qualify for the first round will only be allowed to participate in further rounds. The final round of Panel Discussion will be conducted during MI

Competitions.name: Talent Hunt
Competitions.description: NO talent restrictions and NO cultural boundaries. We believe talent resides in each and everyone and given the chance they will win the hearts of people. Come, participate to prove you are the best at what you do and witness yourself become the ultimate crowd entertainer.

events.name: MI's Got Talent
events.LYP_description: Prize Money of 21,000 rupees & Prizes worth 30,000 rupees
events.description: Have you always longed for a cheering crowd while performing to your heart's content? If yes this is for you! Showcase your talent in front of an enthusiastic crowd and win exciting prizes. Never before has such a heavenly competition been framed. Let the crowd be your judge!
events.rules:
Team Size: Solo+accompanist(if needed)
Judging Criteria: Crowd Engagement, Stage Presence and Overall Performance.

Participants are free to put up any performance
Time Limit:Up to 10 mins (including setup time)

Eliminations

  • Any of the performing arts are allowed in the competititon
  • Any props/instruments required in the performance are to be brought by the participants themselves. Only a basic PA system will be provided by Mood Indigo
  • Any backing track, if required, should be brought by the participant in their own pen drives or played using an AUX cable.
  • The decision of the venue coordinators shall be final and binding. They can stop the performance at any point of time.
  • The participants must set up their phones in stands provided by Mood Indigo and record their performance. They then must upload their videos with appropriate hashtags to be judged.

Finals

  • There will be a finals round everday at the end of the day
  • Winner of one day’s finals cannot participate in the competition again in the coming days

Informals.name: Sherlocked
Informals.description: Only the wittiest shall survive this

events.name: Room Escape
events.description: Addicted to those gaming apps where you have to solve the smallest and cleverest clues to escape the room? Well get ready to be trapped in our clues this time around, literally! You’ll be shut in a room with strangers, and the only way to come out will be to cooperate with each other. Work as a team to break the codes and solve the clues in the room and find the key to open the door. Be warned though! You could be stuck in there for while!

events.name: Treasure Hunt
events.description: Well, who doesn't love an old-fashioned treasure hunt full of wordplay and misleading clues. Well just that this isn't an old-fashioned treasure hunt. Integrated with Snapchat to give you a much more immersive experience and make you believe you're a real-life pirate. This one you should not miss!

events.name: Scramble
events.description: Jigsaw puzzles were really when we were kids right? Well, this jigsaw puzzle has 3-D pieces and will leave you scratching your heads. Only the wittiest shall survive.

events.name: Silent Disco
events.description: The most infamous event in MI. The name says it all. A party where you could enjoy your own music and dance your heart out with friends. This is the stuff dreams are made off.

events.name: Casino Night
events.description:
"Raring to test out that poker face you've been practicing for so long? Well, look no more, coz you've come to the perfect place. The day might come to an end but we’re just getting started! Whether it's the spin of the roulette wheel that catches your eye, or the shouts of 'hit* and 'stay' from the blackjack table that draws you in, the excitement in the air just won't let you leave. 
Spin the wheel and play to your luck. May the odds be ever in your favor!"

events.name: Gully Cricket
events.description: Who doesn't love old styled Gully cricket with deewaar ka chauka and boundary ke bahar out

events.name: Pillow Fight
events.description: A chance to walk into every teenage boy’s fantasy: a pillow fight in a girl’s slumber party. The only difference? Instead of giggling and snickering, there will be a bloodbath... of feathers. It’s because there exists no better feeling than smacking your friend right in the face with a pillow.

events.name: Life Size Pacman
events.description: Pacman. Everyone remembers that cute little yellow ball of love. What if you were him running through a maze from deadly bacterias trying to eat you up. That is exactly what this is about!

events.name: Life Size Connect 4
events.description: Remember when we were kids we used to play Connect 4. Now we have grown up, so is the Connect 4.

Informals.name: Wacky Wonderland
Informals.description: You won't find this anywhere else

events.name: Life Size Jenga
events.description: Pulling it out wrong has always had its concicevences. Well here to pulling out each block will have a cost to bear.

events.name: 3-A-Side Table Tennis
events.description: A wise man once said " The more the merrier". We took his advice. With 3 on 3 match its much more fun than the usual Table Tennis.

events.name: MI Salon
events.description: In older times people used to practice shaving on balloons. We welcome you to MI Salon. You may win or cut your customer's face off. Either way, you will show us you barber-ian side .

events.name: Cards against Humanity
events.description: A classic card game for all the peeps out there

events.name: What do you meme?
events.description: All the meme lords out there are invited. We have the templates ready. Play of your hand and create the most hilarious meme of them all.

events.name: Air Football
events.description: Football just got more interesting. You don't need your legs for this though. Do eat your mints before playing. Blow the hardest to win.

events.name: 4-Way Tug of War
events.description: Tug of War has been a sho of strength and unity. With double the number of people playing the stakes are also higher this time.

events.name: Whack-a-Mole
events.description: Classic Arcade Game. Scaled up to make more fun. Steal goodies from the Hammer-Man while he tries to smash your skull.

Informals.name: Icebreakers
Informals.description: Need help breaking the ice? We got our hammers ready

events.name: Speed Dating
events.description: The best part of the festival is meeting new people. If you know what I mean. Come try your luck !

events.name: People Bingo
events.description: Our own version of Bingo. People are your tickboxes. Find people with the given attributes and get all tickboxes signed. Discover friends in the process. Does it get any better?

events.name: Speak Out
events.description: Might have seen this before. Doesn't look pretty with your mouth wide open but surely is fun.

events.name: Hogathon
events.description: For too long many of us have been ridiculed and shamed for our humongous diet. This is a chance to put it to good use. Participate in our hogathon and win many exciting prizes while getting to eat mouth watering food. The more you eat, the more your chances to triumph. Win-win!

events.name: Beer Pong+Golf
events.description: Sadly we had to kick out the beer from the event but not the fun. A mixture of Golf with Beer Pong, this one you should not miss out on.

events.name: The Spotlight
events.description: Do you have a 10-second talent you wanna show off to the world. This is your chance. If you can spin footballs on your fingertips or do backflips back to back, come join us for this show-off.

Informals.name: Streets and Waiting lines
Informals.description: We won't ever leave you bored
